description:
I like coming here on Sundays for all the football games. Julien, the bartender, is always friendly and on top of things. I just wish he had some support behind the bar or to run food orders. Seems that most Sundays he's on his own and it can delay things.

Order the famous Kezar buffalo wings and Breakfast is delicious too, especially the chorizo scramble.
author: Oscar T.

description:
Been coming here infrequently for a few years.  Was a good place.

Not sure what changed recently but some new direction of management changes and severe staffing shortage have created problems with service, especially with the food.
author: Robert M.

description: This is the new Chelsea FC supporter's bar. Perfect place to catch a match! Great TVs and beer selection, nice staff, good vibes :)
author: Liz A.

description: Had an Amazing time at this new Chelsea Fc Bar.  The supporters are so motivated and loud!  Let's go Chelsea  Definitely coming back.  Great food and drinks.  And they open early for all the matches.  Also they are a Chelsea Fc Certified official Bar.  This is awesome!  No better place to watch the games in the Bay.  Nickies Bar has my vote!!  Had an awesome time!
author: Raymond R.

description: This is the best place to watch a Chelsea match! It's a great place to take in a game and wonderful staff. The beer selection is on point and the food is delicious! Plus if you're a vegetarian they have options for you too.
author: Dan D.

description: Went on suggestions from yelp. They do not disappoint! Service was on hit, and I ordered a shepherds pie and loved it! The only thing I found different in house vs. Yelp was the menu selection is much smaller than pictured on here but that's not even an issue.
author: Lauren M.

description: The food we ordered ( mozerella sticks) were alright, but the drinks are affordable. It's a nice sports bar to hangout and drink with your friends!
author: Kaylee P.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco for work and had about 6 hours to explore the city on my last day. It was Sunday and I was craving eggs or french toast, because I'm predictable. A little after 11am, there wasn't much open in the area and I found a sports bar with a high rating show up on my brunch search -- Nickies. A little timid, I decided to check it out. An unassuming bar with surprisingly good food.

There weren't many people in the establishment yet, but a couple of ladies at the bar with DOGS, and I was living. Anyway, they let me seat myself anywhere so I took a booth near the window where I could people watch and also watch soccer on the TVs. The bar itself is large, with lots of seating, especially toward the back. Bathrooms are also clean, which I think says a lot about how you run a restaurant/bar.

They don't have a huge menu, for good reason, so when my server came around, I was set on the breakfast burrito, which comes with a free side, so I ordered the hash browns. I waited maybe less than 10 minutes for the food to arrive. For a sports bar, the presentation was beautiful and burrito was even better. I loved that they included little potato slices inside the burrito. A+. Also came with a side of pico. Hash browns were also hot and delicious, and a larger portion than I expected. Prices are what you'd expect -- around $13 for an entree, but honestly, life is too short to eat shitty food.

From my perspective, Nickies seems to be a consistent, reliable go-to for no frills brunch food. I'd love to come back and try out that mimosa special next time.
author: Jordan B.

description:
Wanted to check out a new place for brunch and bottomless mimosas. Found Nickies on Yelp and definitely thought we should try it out! 

First off, if you are trying to find a place that is a crazy, fun, a place with loud music, etc. this is not the place to go. My group and I weren't trying to find a place like that, but thought of something more mellow but the same kind of vibes. Nickies was more of a calm place as a whole.

The bottomless mimosas in particular were pretty good, not the best I've ever had, but they got the job done. At one point, we asked the server if we could just have the carafe they were using rather so we could fill them up ourselves.

The food was really good too, definitely not something we were expecting. I got the breakfast burrito with the hash brown casserole. It was delicious! The pricing for food was what you would normally pay in San Francisco for brunch, so we were not surprised.
author: Michael T.

description:
Came in to watch the rest of the Huskies game because we needed a bar with hard liquor!!! It was a late night the kitchen was closing but the bar was still open. We ordered devil eggs and wings. 

The devil eggs are AMAZING!!!!!!!! The best devil eggs I have ever had and that is saying a lot because my sister can put her foot in some devil eggs. So DEVIL EGGS are a WINNER!! 

The wings: the Guinness wings are to dieeee for!!!! Like I couldn't stop eating them! The sauce is amazing!!!!!  You can't go wrong with the Guinness wings. It's like a smoky BBQ flavor!! I be back for these as well.
author: Dorothy M.

description:
It seems like damn near every bar on Haight is either beer/wine only, and/or cash only. Then Nickies shows up with a full bar and the ability to take credit cards - and without the sour attitude or smell of the beer halls nearby (Toronado, I'm looking at you. Sorry not sorry). 

Came here to grab some drinks before rollerskating and even though it was busy, I never had to wait long for my order. Our server was the absolute sweetest and gave us some great food recommendations. Unfortunately, the kitchen closes at 9 so be sure to get there early for some grub! We had the bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers and totchos (!!!!!!!!) with steak, and both of the dishes were outstanding. 

Apparently this is the place to be when there's a soccer match. 

Super chill, fun vibe, friendly staff, and you don't need to stop by an ATM. What's not to love?
author: Angela L.

description: Bloody Mary Review - I've always thought of winking as creepy. Like something your suspicious neighbor does while watering the lawn or something the grocery line cashier does while scanning your box of condoms and bottle of wine. But when you get that perfect wink, the wink that makes you blush, the wink that turns you into a gitty Japanese school girl, the true glory and power of the wink is unveiled. I experienced just such a wink at Nickies. And I won't say that it put the proverbial garnish on my stout topped bloody mary, but I will say, I'll be back for more. Why go? Winks and a stout topped bloody. | Price: $9
author: Shelley B.

description:
best service ever.

The last time i visited was was 7 years ago but it still remains to be mega chill and accommodating. solid drafts and fast service. No pretentiousness and plenty of space.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
It's my favorite spot for food, drink and for sure watching sport.
great service and chef and Friday eve music DJ incredible.
but if you fan of other sports don't come over on american football days.
author: Benjamin J.

description: Awesome vibes and chill people. Great servers. Deviled eggs, hot wings, fries, chips - all great. Not a fan of the chicken sandwich, but the burger is solid and I like the shrimp po boy too. The bacon jalepeno poppers are pretty serious. share these and don't let it go cold. Best thing on the menu hands down are the Nickies Nachos served on tots. Fairly sizeable selection of beers on tap, but just the usual Northern California bar selection. Had some champagne here too (Wycliff and Chamdeville) but hit or miss on getting the ice bucket. Tons of TVs. Nice restrooms.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
A good neighborhood bar if you're in the lower haight. Out of my way to get here but the food was really good and drinks as well. Good prices. Good amount of tables and chairs. A good hang out spot. Our server last night was a bit slow. Didn't really ask if we needed anything, we had to flag her down, sorry chased her down. That was a bummer.

But lets go WARRIORS!
author: Sandy B.

description:
I liked it so much I went twice - in one day!

Around noon I wandered in looking to kill a bit of time while my tattoo artist finished up my sketch. I didn't want to drink before my tattoo but they had so many temptations it was a struggle to say no. 

They were offering an awesome brunch menu when we stumbled in and though I wasn't hungry there is no such thing as too much food when you get a tattoo. I opted for a pancake. The bartender was kind enough to tell me they were quite large so I opted for just one. Thank goodness because they were quite large. 1 was plenty for a "snack." When it arrived I cut it open and saw the yummy mascarpone inside. I added a tiny amount of maple syrup and bit into heaven. I get nervous about the first bit of any pancake - will it be mush, will it be crunchy, will it have flavor or just be weird batter. The mascarpone was great inside of the pancake. Great flavor. 

It was so good in fact I told my wife we should come by after my tattoo and try their dinner menu. Yes, there are plenty of options in the area but c'mon a slamming fancy pancake for brunch necessitates a return trip... within a few hours if possible - haha.

Many hours later, after my tattoo was finished, we wandered back in for drinks and dinner. We rolled up to the bar and settled in on the comfortable barstools. Why do I mention they are comfortable? My wife has trouble sitting at bars because her feet never touch the floor or the barstool cross bar. These however had the perfect size cushion as well as a foot rest. I feel for everyone else on the short side height wise, this is a perk.

I ordered the rib eye and wifey opted for the shrimp po' boy. The rib eye was delivered about halfway through my beer. I don't usually like brussels sprouts but apparently, once drowned in sugar and vinegar, I am a huge fan! The rib eye had good flavor but the flavoring was a bit strong by the time I was approaching the last few bites. The potatoes were great and had the skins mixed in which broke up the texture for a nice change.

The wifey wanted more heat in her po' boy but aside from lacking the spice and heat she said the portion was nice. 

Overall, the vibe and food in this place are both awesome. 

Come in, watch a game, chat with some friends and enjoy this place.
author: Sabrina B.

description:
I've been told this neighborhood is called Lower Haight, well there's nothing to Haight about this place.. get it? 

Puns aside, the food here is surprisingly good. You'd think a sports bar in a nondescript location would be questionable, but everything we had was great. That included the Deviled Eggs, Fries, and Bruschetta (thanks to the previous reviews). I ordered the Fries with the Lemon Aoili and I can't recommend the combo enough. Fancy mayo should be sold in bulk. 

The last notable thing was the service. Our waitress and the bartender, too were friendly and engaging. She definitely made someone like me surrounded by sports fans comfortable. Top notch.
author: Luci H.

description:
As the Duke of Nickies I must say it is one of the finest parts of my kingdom. Monday's are the best with the double threat of WWE RAW hosted by SFWWC and Brainstormers Trivia after. I will grant any serf a full days leave to visit this event. 

Positive: Open to big groups and events, clean bathrooms, brunch, and great service. 

Negative: no temp control (hot on hot days cold on cold days), no tap cleaning, no fun events.
author: Eric J.

description: Nothing better than a great neighborhood spot! Excellent price point on the drinks & they have a full draft beer menu. There are more than 10 screens throughout the bar - making it possible to see the game(s) from every area.
author: Nick S.

description:
Super nice bar - more of a sports bar.
The servers are so nice, especially that I'm pregnant at the moment and I don't feel left out that I can't drink. :) 
Bathrooms are super clean.

Food:
1. Tot-chos: tater tot nachos - big plate of them with lots of pico de gallo, guac, jalapeños, sour cream (5/5)
2. Buffalo wings: super spicy (I eat spicy all the time, love siracha, Korean food), good flavor (4/5)
3. Jalapeño poppers wrapped in bacon: nice and warm, who can say no to bacon? :) (5/5)

Would come here again!
author: Mary H.

description: Everything I look for in a bar. Spacious, tons of TVs, good food, good drinks. Love Nickies!
author: Matt J.

description: Absolutely LOVE the food at this bar! My burger was crazy good, perfectly cooked. Drinks here are awesome 10 stars if allowed.
author: jasmine d.

description: Not bad. Really good service especially for a dive on Haight where bartenders are ready to rip off your face for asking for a napkin.
author: Nika C.

description: This restaurant and Irish bar is OUTSTANDING!!  I probably should have taken a picture of the food before we ate it all!  First, $15 bottomless Mimosas are a STEAL in SF!  Second, they serve the best eggs Benedict I have ever had in the United States! I recommend getting it with their first class tender pork belly!  My husband's breakfast sandwich was also excellent and they have chipotle hollandaise sauce that is to die for.  Despite being a little crowded (you will soon understand why!) the service was still good.  Our bill for two was Iike $60 but we drank a good bit. Do yourself a favor and have Saturday/Sunday brunch here FOR THE REST OF YOUR LIFE!
author: Nechelle B.

description: Service was BAD and I had to get up and get everything myself, plates, napkins, find the waitress for more drinks. She even complained about wiping the dirty table (Sunday Football, no excuse) I would star this place with one star if it didn't have the great bar food it had. The food is the saving grace. Wings are meaty and delicious, the burger was a damn good burger, they got this right! The tater tots, I can say the best in SF.
author: Sarah T.

description:
As a Broncos fan in the Bay, this place feels like home for the entire football season. Super fun energy, good prices, and it's always a fun atmosphere on game days. 

Plus, for a high energy sports bar, the food is surprisingly excellent. I can get spicy buffalo wings, mountains of nachos, and a *really nice* kale salad. What else could you want?
author: K. H.

description: Great local bar with a decent selection of beers and pub style food. Service was top notch, too. We'll be back!
author: Steve B.

description: What great food!! Everything cooked to order and very fresh. Our table had the hamburger with onion rings, chicken sandwich (2), one with fries the other with the Brussels sprouts and the philly cheese steak. All were absolutely delicious!!! Our waitress, Tiffany, was THE BEST. Polite, witty, fun , attractive and attentive when needed. Will be rushing back to this establishment for Sunday brunch !!
author: Gary R.

description:
This place is great for throwing parties! I had a party here last week for about 25 people. I called ahead of time and they reserved the back area for us. I pre-ordered a mix of sliders, they have four different kinds. They were all delicious and much bigger than I expected. The waitress was great, very attentive, came over to take orders frequently and went through the extra effort to split people's bills. The DJ booth was empty that night and there was a juke box so you can pick your own music. It can be tough to find a great place for groups in SF so just wanted to pass this along. 
By the way they have revamped the whole place I remember partying here years ago!
author: Dana C.

description: I love this bar. It is easy to take over because it's never too full and he bartenders are awesome. There is lots of seating and even a small dance floor in the back. This spot gets really fun on Saturday nights!
author: Shruti S.

description:
One of the best bars in SF.  Service, management, food (!!!), and drinks are top notch.  The food especially blows me away every time; I really think the burger is better than anything else I've had in the city and is not overpriced. The liquor selection gets a thumbs up with many Irish Whiskeys I have not seen elsewhere. You don't smell the draft lines unlike some bars up the street. Nickie's runs a tight ship and you can tell the management takes care of the place and cares about providing good food and drank. Lots of cool memorabilia on the walls to check out too. 

The vibe changes throughout the day - I've seen families + kids at the large tables for brunch, NFL fans wearing EVERY jersey on Sundays and a full on club/dance scene on Friday/Saturday nights. I've met multiple ex-girlfriends on the dance floor.
author: Gustavo V.

description: I randomly stopped in for a beer on a weekday afternoon and sat by the window to read my book. There is plenty of seating here, with TVs to watch the game. Good vibes at the bar with this group of guys catching up with each other. The bartender was very friendly and professional that day. Happy hour was cool too! I think it was $5 for my IPA. Great neighborhood bar. Would come here again (and perhaps try some of their food) but not on a game night!
author: Stefanie C.

description: AVOID THIS PLACE IF YOU'RE BAY AREA SPORTS FAN!!! Went to Nickies to watch the Warriors opening night/ring ceremony last night. Place wasn't busy and we found a table easily to watch the game. While waiting for the game, the MLB playoffs were on and the main sound system had the MLB game on. We were there early so we figured like every bay area bar, they'd switch to the Warriors game when the game started. 10 min into the ring ceremony, the sound wasn't switched to the Warriors game. Me and a few patrons asked for the sound to be switched but we were told 2 dodger fans were watching the game and wanted the sound to be left on the MLB game. Look I would understand if a bay area team was playing but it was the dodger/cubs game. Also this wasn't a reg game as it was opening night/ring ceremony for the Warriors!  This is the bay area, 90% of the bar was there for the Warriors game!!!
author: Ron W.

description: Start off by saying I loved the food and wish I could give you guys 5 stars. Amazing environment, lots of TV's, different games playing so nobody is upset, missing out on what they wanna watch! Great beer Options, I had the Nickie's burger with onion Rings, and a lagunita's on tap for under 20$. the burger was cooked to perfection and was delicious! I will definitely be returning for these reasons. However, I must say customer service shall always be a top priority! The young lady who served me just seemed really aggravated and in a rush. Understandable, i know we all have off days but please don't take it out on a paying customer especially when they come in for a good experience! Another tip for you lady- DON'T ASK PEOPLE IF THEY WANT THEIR CHANGE! DON,T ASK FOR TIPS! ALMOST MADE ME WANT TO SAY, YES GIVE ME MY CHANGE! But something inside me was still sweet enough to let her keep it lol. I work in customer service i know how vital tips can be to somebody's lifestyle, however you might get a better tip if you aren't asking for it or expecting somebody to give it to you. That was just really annoying have some common decency! maybe I'm just a little sensitive lol.
author: Brienna S.

description:
This place is a hidden gem for brunch. Every dish weakens your knees and induces moans of ecstacy as you find yourself submitting to the flavors that take you away to your happy place. It's just ridiculously tasty.

You cannot believe how deliscious the breakfast sandwich is. Don't deny yourself that experience!

The service is freaking fantastic - quick, informed, personable. Just what you need.

This is also the first place I've found in SF that offers a pretty darn complete traditional Irish breakfast.
author: Ayaire C.

description:
Woo-hoo! The transition period has ended! My neighborhood bar is once again a fun place to be!
They have some great new bartenders and the service is improving!!!!
author: erica s.

description:
I came here for the first time when the Broncos won the AFC championship!! (Woooohoooo!!) I love that this bar is a Broncos bar and I can cheer with my fellow bleeders of orange and blue. The environment is really fun to watch the game and there are TVs EVERYWHERE, so you don't have to crank your neck to watch the game.

The food and beer is good here (I ordered the fried chicken and my boyfriend got the burger with onion rings - both tasty).

Only downside? One of the bartenders was incredibly rude. She acted like I was annoying her whenever I asked for a beer... Hello? This is your job. She was also wearing a Patriots jersey... Just steer clear of her and you won't have anything to complain about.

I'm sad it took me this long to come to this bar, but very happy I know about it now! I'll be here every football Sunday!

Go Broncos!
author: Emmy Q.

description:
This is a truly love / hate relationship. 

I am in LOVE with this bar because it's cozy and I'm a Broncos fan. My jersey. Food. Beer. My people. I'm home, every Sunday. 

HOWEVER, the bartenders are the rudest, most unaccommodating bartenders I've ever dealt with.   I * almost * walked out on a Broncos playoff game. That's how bad it was. (But, luckily, I know where my loyalties lie.) 

Bottom line? I'm a die-hard Broncos fan, so I'll be here. 

But you can't get upset with patrons crowding the bar when it's post-season at a Broncos bar and the best-team-ever is playing. ;)

Get it together, ladies.
author: Amanda U.

description: Great amount of tvs. Service was very good. But there's no AC. Very hot inside. Would have stayed longer if it wasn't so hot.
author: Mark B.

description:
Been going to Nickies every Bronco's gameday for 3 seasons straight. 

The waitstaff are what make it feel like home. Meghan, Paulina, and Shannon always welcome our group with a hug and a cold Bud Light - which they bring before we even ask for it because they know what we drink! 

Even when it's busy, the servers do an awesome job of making sure we are taken care of. They find a way to make it through the crowds with our food and drinks. They don't wait for you to ask for a drink; they check in on you frequently to make sure you're always happy. 

If Shannon weren't a Patriot's fan, I'd like her even more ;)
author: Kassy S.

description: Great bar to hang out with friends. I was here recently with my boyfriend and his coworkers. The music was great and we were able to make some requests (there was a DJ since it was Friday night), which made us want to dance! :) The staff is friendly and there are good drinks. It was busy at night but not too busy, so it was easy to get a table. There were TVs here so you can watch the game if you want, but on the night I went it was a mix of music videos and kids cartoons Lol. I expect I'll be back soon enough! ;)
author: Bianca C.

description:
Came here to watch Sunday Night football on a cold SF winter night. The irish coffee knocked out the chill and it was super yummy. I like the amount of tvs and the servers. Pretty attentive for a bar. 

I can't wait to come back to try some of the food. The menu looked pretty good and there were some awesome deals before 3pm.
author: Amber C.

description:
The best bar for football in the city. Laura, Meghan, Shannon  and Paulina are like family. 

This bar is it is no longer a Broncos bar! They moved to the athletic club. Orange has been crushed, although it's funny to watch the holdovers scream at every play. Bandwagon fans are hilarious. 

Breakfast burritos are delicious and the wings; crispy and meaty, always free! Just see Canadian Steve , he's in the lions jersey at the bar!

This is a Packers, Lions, Chargers Bar!
author: Drew M.

description:
I figured it's time to updated my review. So there's been some changes - new chef and new menu. The food is delish! Try the the mac & cheese and the salmon tacos. This is a great neighborhood bar and if you go there consistently, you'll get to know the regulars who live around the area. The staff and patrons are always friendly. 

I just read a review and want to point out something: if it's busy, yes, you'll be acknowledged, however if you're not ready to order, you can't expect them to wait for you to figure out what you want. Either go up to the bar knowing what you want to order or be patient. This really should be a tip to any bar you go to.
author: Lo L.

description: Nickies is a fun place to be. Good drinks, great music, solid eats ... what more can you ask for?!
author: Roman V.

description: Thank you guys for an amazing service tonight and for a great  spen at your bar. Prices are good, location also. Beer selection is huge. What else do you need from sport bar.
author: Liza W.

description:
Nickies is my new Monday night date.  

Pros:
Roman is a great bartender. 
Pub trivia by Dave from Brainstormer
The Irish waitress whose name eludes me when I'm sober is very sweet and really quick.
Wifi
Cheap drafts
It's a fairly large bar so you don't ever really feel crowded and there are bathrooms on both levels.
Vegetarian nachos ftw!

Cons:
There are very few vegetarian options on the menu; there could be more...a dish of mashed potatoes doesn't count as dinner (I wish it did.).
10 person trivia teams who use their cell phones...for shame.  If you're competitive this will annoy you.

Overall score: solid 4.5
author: Lily A.

description:
I don't know what Ashley A. is talking about. I've been to Nickie's hundreds of times in the past few years, and Meghan is the absolute best. She's always sweet and friendly, and I can't think of a single time that she hasn't greeted us with a smile. The bar can get really hectic sometimes, but I've always appreciated how the service has always been good. 

Great selection of beer, and the food has always been solid. Can get a little crowded during big sports games, but if you come early and grab a table, there are plenty of TVs everywhere to catch all the action. 

A neighborhood favorite.
author: Attiya A.

description: Worst place i have ever been. the "head" bar tender was such a rude person. I wish i could give them 0 stars
author: Jessica S.

description: Ordered bloody Mary, smoked ceasar salad . Salad bomb . My friend had their wings. Supper delicious had a little spicy kick to it.
author: Des P.

description:
Sean, the manager of Nickies contacted me regarding my review so I would like to clear up some information. 

This review is regarding an experience in the spring of 2012. It was written at that time on a duplicate account and was reposted under this account when the duplicate was deleted:

He also informed me they no longer serve bottomless mimosas.

05/2012:
I'm giving this an extra star because the food was good but I'm inclined to give it 1 star because we came here for brunch and the service was horrible.Waited 30 minutes to put an order in when it didn't seem busy (plenty of empty tables)A person in our group ordered a soda and never got it.Our bottomless mimosas remained empty during the majority of our visit.Waited another 20+ minutes only to be informed that the food I ordered was unavailable, had I been told that upon ordering I would have immediately went to another pub.  I was given my second choice AFTER everyone I was with was already finished eating.Our server was never around and the overall service was terrible. I know of plenty other gastropubs in the city so I will not be returning to this one.The bar is nice and clean and the restrooms were clean.
author: Brittany W.

description:
They had me at bottomless mimosas. 

Ordered the eggs florentine. Had good flavor, but I wish the poached egg was a little less cooked through. Wasn't a perfect poached egg, but the hollandaise sauce was pretty good, despite its very yellow color. The potatoes on the side were just okay.. Wish they were cooked a little more because they were on the harder side.

My mimosa glass was never empty-- just the way I like it at brunch. :)
author: Leslie C.

description: Hey, we got in after the game and it was a blast.  We partied like it was 1999...again.  The place was a blur of orange.  Broncos' fans lit the place up! Even though I'm a Pats fan, I was almost-entirely-happy for the team.  We even got on TV somewhere, now that's hot.
author: Mo B.

description:
wow - gr8t Sportsbar! Thanx @ Shannon 4 all ... we spend a funny time in that bar! Fast beer, funny, friendly, very attentive Service, good audience, gr8t Barfood - We felt right at home!! Even 4 German Bundesliga ( Soccer )!

We`ll coming back
author: Michael R.

description:
I went to Nickie's last night to watch the Spurs-Warriors and Kings-Sharks games. Fun place! It definitely has the festive atmosphere of a sports bar - however, I was surprised how small their many flat screen TVs were... they looked to be 21"? 

Our waitress was extremely nice but I had to prompt her after 45 minutes to ask about the spinach salad I had ordered when I first arrived. She explained, "Sorry, I put the order in, but the kitchen is slammed". I pointed out that two guys had sat down at the table next to ours -around10 minutes after I had ordered- and had been served their burgers already (they were halfway through when I flagged her down). She was very embarrassed by this, apologized profusely, and then said she would take my salad off my bill (a nice gesture). Minutes later, my giant spinach salad arrived. Nothing special but since it was almost 9:00 p.m. and I was hungry, it hit the spot. 

Another thing is we had to flag her down every time we wanted a drink. When I ordered my 1st beer, my friend sat there with an empty glass and she didn't ask him if he needed another drink. He literally had to get HER attention to order another drink. I used to be a cocktail waitress and I was very surprised about this. 

On a bright side, they have a good selection of beers on tap, and several good IPAs (my fave).  I also was pleasantly surprised how nice/clean their bathrooms were!! These things, as well as the fun atmosphere and getting my salad comped, brings my review up from 3.5 stars to 4 stars. 

I'll be back to watch more sports games but will not expect good service when they get busy!
author: Wendy N.

description:
Oh Nickies, why don't I visit you more often?
I need to trek outside the 'Divisadero Corridor' and check out the gems that Lower Haight has to offer. Nickies is one of them.

Nickies is a solid and well maintained Irish joint with TVs throughout the bar area, and even a DJ booth. When my friends and I stopped by a few weeks ago, the DJ was playing some digalicious old and modern beats. Thankfully, the music wasn't too loud so we could actually hear each other.

Nickies is stocked with your standard spirits and plenty of beer on tap. Can you say HO? HO HO HO (Tis the season, hee hee)!  Yup, they have my beloved Hoegaarden on tap! Awesomeness! Not many bars have this gorgeous white and refreshing Belgian beer on tap, so I didn't think twice about what my drink of choice would be for the evening. 
It doesn't always have to be about the Grey Goose for me, as I like to mix it up. AnywHOoters, I had to have a few rounds of the HO, ya know?

Will need to return to NIckies to maybe check out their Monday Trivia Night, but most definitely to try their food, and to get more HO on tap!

Cheers!
author: Gill C.

description: Awesome local sports bar! Great food and tons of memorabilia! Love the fish tacos! Get there early for Happy Hour!
author: Rodney D.

description:
After MANY MANY years of coming here as it is my neighborhood.... I won't EVER BE BACK......
HORRIFIC FOOD POISIONING.

 sad too loved when this was the fam biz but yesterday sum skank super sweaty waitresses waddles over and 1st thing says ERRRRRRRPPPPP......... IM SOO LAZY AND HUNG OVER, AND NO MORE BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS... WHATCHA WANT????

oh really... PROB cuz you've been guzzling the hooch in the back... 

Too bad, when the family was running this it was great, now ive got FOOD POISONING...... SAD..SAD..SAD...
author: Nana W.

description: When the sharks and Warriors were in the playoffs this was my go to sports bar. Good prices, selection of beer, and the food is pretty good too. For a big game come early.
author: Shawn T.

description: Good sports bar. FYI -- as of November 7, 2015, they no longer do bottomless mimosas. It's $20 for a bottle of champagne (comes with oj).
author: Lenny G.

description: Trivia was ok on a Monday night. Questions came through very very slowly but the drink selection is good. We ordered wings at 8:40. A little before 9 our server asked if we wanted any other food and we said the wings were enough. At 9:40 we said she could cancel the order for wings because they were so late, and she knelt down to apologize because she had never put the order in. Very frustrating, but I'm sure they're capable of better
author: Michael C.

description: I have an emotional relationship with Nickies and no matter what they serve, I'll keep coming back. But I must say I wept literal tears when they changed the menu. Where are the best nachos in the city? Where are my beloved BUFFALO chicken wings?? Bring back the old menu or at least the two dishes I rave about :( I'm pouring one out for the old Nickies menu and still trying to get over it. Where did the old chef go??
author: Lisa H.

description: The bar is okay, the crowd can be a little over the top. Prices aren't great, but close to other food spots and bars that are more fun and cheaper.
author: Joey P.

description:
Too loud 
The food was surprisingly good for a bar - I had the fish and chips they were great. I went to meet up with friends but it was so loud we couldn't have a conversation more than one person at a time.
author: Leda M.

description: The brunch breakfast has always been solid but now it is simply amazing!  The new breakfast sandwich is the best I have ever had!  And with cheddar grits on the side!  Wow so so excellent!
author: Daniel A.

description: Love love love this bar,great atmosphere awesome staff the bartenders at Nickie's are seriously the best in the city and are extremely sweet and hilarious. They have live music on Tuesdays,DJ's Thursday through Saturday. The food is absolutely amazing not your average bar eats that's for sure! Definitely stop in for a drink and some of the fish tacos. This is my go to bar when I just want to have a good time.
author: Lulu R.

description:
I came here to watch a niners game once. It was pretty packed. I made the mistake of bringing food in and the waitress kindly said that since the owner is here she didn't want me to eat it inside. No big deal, I stuffed the rest of the sausage from Rosamounde's down the hatch.

The funny thing is, I would have ordered from the place if I could have managed to find a seat.

Anyways, I came here at another time when it was less busy on a weeknight. I ordered the burger with gouda cheese. Wow, the cheese really made it delicious. I seriously enjoyed it a lot and scarfed it down pretty quick. I will order a burger from here again.
author: Marty J.

description: I really dig this place. Good drinks, great food, tons of sports and they're playing Steve Earle right now. You guys got my vote for sure. The mozzarella sticks destroy!!!
author: David B.

description:
Have been here a few times now, so figured it was time to write the ol' Yelp review. This place is funny - from the outside it looks like your standard neighborhood bar, nothing out of the ordinary. But upon entering it adopts one of many faces: local watering hole, sports bar, English/Irish pub, brunch spot, dance-y DJ nights. It is pretty much a chameleon. This review is based solely upon the local watering hole / pub atmosphere, as that is the only time I've really experienced it. I have been here on game nights (MNF and ThNF) but ended up leaving after realizing it was game night and no tables were to be found. I wasn't going there to watch the game, just to eat, so moved on elsewhere.

Anyway, I'm pretty sure the guy I'm dating is obsessed with this place. Actually, he's said so. And since I get bored easily (makes his life hard, huh?) I rarely will be one to frequent a place unless it is something special. Well, Nickie's, I guess you win. Drinks are always tasty and poured right (our personal faves? the Moscow and Kentucky mules), food is always delicious (I'm a fan of the grilled fish and garlic fries, he tends towards the fried chicken or mac and cheese), and service attentive (being frequent fliers probably helps in this area; the servers almost put the drink orders in as my guy enters the bar).

All in all a solid spot. We will be back, probably.. Tuesday.
author: Allison B.

description:
Terrible service.
Decent food.

I recommend coming here only for drinks. Our servers name was Meghan G and she was the worst server I've ever had in my life. If you get her I would ask for someone else. I went to the restroom and on my way back I saw our food in the kitchen window. We watched our server take drinks to all her other tables, take two tables' food orders and go up and down the stairs that lead to the kitchen 3 times before getting our food. The food was lukewarm but tasted okay. Our server was extremely impatient, rushed us the entire time, would ask if we needed anything and then not give us enough time to even respond. She was hollering at us from across the bar while walking up the stairs to another table, did not notice my empty beer or ask if I wanted another round; we had to flag her down from across the bar just to get her to come over to us. She took away our utensils/extra napkins before we were done, asked if we were all done & dropped our check when we still had a full beer & a double shot. We let the check sit there because we were not done and we were thinking about ordering another drink before we left. She came over again to pick it up and we said we weren't finished with it. She gave us a dirty look and walked away, then proceeded to go to the table next to us and talk about how she hates tables that sit there for super long and then tip her $5. She came up yet again and said 'well I've been here since 8am and I'm trying to go home now.' At that point I was so irritated I decided to write a list for her on the back of the receipt as to why she receive a crappy tip. She had the nerve to come up to us and start yelling at me about how I am passive aggressive and if I had an issue with the service I could have said something to her personally. I responded by saying you never gave us any time to let us speak. She continued to yell so I asked for a manager. I explained the issue to a female, blonde bartender (I didn't catch her name). She apologized and said her service was unacceptable. She told us to come sit up at the bar and bought us a round of drinks on the house.
author: Ashley A.

description:
I came here last night, and this pub is everything a good neighborhood bar should be.

Flat-screen TV's on the walls playing sports? Yep. Friendly locals from the neighborhood? Yep. Excellent drinks? Yep. Delicious comfort bar food? Yep. Irish waitress who is sweeter than a Swisher? Double yep.

Nickies gives Mad Dog In The Fog and Danny Coyle's a good run for their money. You can actually find seating here, and even when the crowd starts to form after 10PM, it doesn't feel stuffy or pretentious. 

This is the sweet spot among other well-known Lower Haight bars. Leave your stress at the door, settle in with a strong drink, and let the Irish waitress charm you out of your pants (or wallet). I love this place!
author: Maurice R.

description: Delicious food! Fantastic service and loads of craic! The staff is inviting and attentive! The atmosphere is great for sports games! And trivia night was so much fun for the group of us!
author: Sandy H.

description:
(More like a 3.5, but hey ... )

Like for many, this was a TV and sports kind of deal, paired with their pubfare one night, the brunch one morning, and drinks all the time, of course.

Their menu comes with the usuals for an Irish style sports pub: burger, wings, shepherd's pie (which I believe they call Guiness steak something-or-other), fish and chips; for brunch, eggs benedict, huevos rancheros, a scramble plate, an egg breakfast with sausage and bacon. You get the pic. The burger was good (though it tops out at 12 bucks after gouda and bacon are added to round it out). Fish and chips got the thumbs down, and the Guiness steak/shepherd's pie got the highest marks. Yum! I wish they had put the tortillas on the side, rather than beneath the goods, for the huevos rancheros, which was okay. (You know what you're getting yourself into when ordering plates with Spanish names at an Irish style pub -- or at least you should.)

The coup de grace? The mac n cheese. It is that good. Like THAT good. Or should I say gouda? They must have a gouda aficionado among the staff: can't remember tasting a better one, one that is flavorful and compliments its edible partners. It was the secret to the burger and to the mac n cheese. Do not come here without having tried the mac n cheese. Just don't. My table partners insisted it is the best in the world.

For brunch they serve mimosas and 5 buck (at the time of this writing) bloody mary's. With a crew, go for the full bottle of champagne w/OJ, rather than individualized mimosas -- this ain't grade school no more, and you'll save some dough.

Comfy, with a less rowdy & sloppy crowd than Dog in the Fog, plenty of TVs, and food that gets it done, albeit a few bucks higher than I'd like -- all in all, a trip here makes for a good game day!
author: Robbie B.

description: wings are no good, frozen! Good service at the bar, great potato skins, great atmosphere
author: Travis B.

description:
Great food and drinks. All
American menu with generous portions and very good service, our server Shannon was so nice and friendly. highly recommend.
author: Chad P.

description:
Nice little neighborhood spot with excellent buffalo wings.  Service is friendly and mellow.  

If we plan on arriving early enough, it even makes a nice place for dinner with our kid.  (We are not foolish enough to bring our kid to dinner here on a big game night or past 7pm.)

Chicken tortilla soup, when they have it, is amazing.  Like someone's mom is in the kitchen making it.  

Mac and cheese here is watery and bland.  Run away!
author: Lorin Y.

description:
Crackin on a sat night, with loud music and lights haha. Good all around place to go for some munchings, drinkings, dancing, game-watching, pool-playing. In the middle of the Lower Haight, so conveniently around other things to walk to before or after.

11.11.13
author: Angela L.

description: Stopped by here at 10pm and were told the kitchen was closed, yet we saw multiple people get food up until 10:35.  The atmosphere was great and the food looked amazing, but the service was disappointing.
author: Heather L.

description: Love the food! I ate almost every snack on the menu! Literally the food pAcks a punch! The drinks are decent...bartenders are cool...waitress super nice...I will be back with the ladies again! Btw if your a die hard broncos fan heres a good bar! They had the menu and towels, all that!
author: Maria R.

description:
After I spent the last 5 minutes telling the other half of the Dream Team why I didn't like this place...

This is actually a great bar to watch sports, eat, and hang out at. Much preferred to Danny Coles, it has cell phone service and a multi-stall women's loo. 

If they put the Laker's game on, I'd totally come here and watch it.
author: Emily D.

description: I love Nickies so much. We came here for the first time two years ago for the pub quiz, it was the first Monday after we moved to San Francisco. Roman the bartender and Geraldine the server were so friendly and welcoming that because of them (and the excellent pub quiz, drinks and food) we've pretty much been coming back every Monday night since. It feels like a genuine local bar (although we're not local), regulars are great, it has pretty much all the sports you could hope for, excellent choice of beer, and tasty food.
author: Andrew M.

description: Great service and beer selection. We came here to do Fernet's shots and left with a bit of a stumble. The overall sports bar themes works well and reminds me of my college days. The atmosphere is inviting and the drinks keep coming.
author: James C.

description: The drinks were good, place was ok, food was decent, but the service was horrendous. Not the waitress' fault as she was the only one serving the whole restaurant. Get this girl another coworker.
author: Jacob A.

description:
I have been coming here for two years every sunday during football season for Denver Broncos football and it is always a great time.  I love the crew of people this place draws and it is one of the best sports bars in the area.  If you are a Broncos fan this place is a must.

Besides the football aspect, I love Nickies because they have good beer on tap, make awesome bloody mary's, have yummy food that isn't super expensive and the bartenders and servers put up with all of our shit!
author: Kirsten O.

description:
Friend looked up this place on yelp and this is how we found it. Or else normally we would not walk in.

Beer is pretty good, good selection. Games are on TV, so it can get get really loud and crazy. Good place to chill, but didn't like the nachos very much. 

Waitress was very nice, but maybe she was tired, so didn't really care to offer any recommendations even when I asked for it. Just shrugged and said "meh everything is good and depends on what you feel." Flat three stars for that.
author: Jessica C.

description: Long overdue! My friend and I celebrated our birthday here back in November! Called and spoke to Shannon to reserve tables. The day of our celebration there was a beautiful floral arrangement and champagne chilling for us on the table!!!! Beautiful gesture!!!! Our friends had a great great time dancing to the great DJ Icue spinning!!!! Drinks and service were great!!!!! Love coming here!!!!!
author: raquel t.

description: I normally don't frequent sports bars, but my friends and I stumbled in near midnight yesterday (Saturday) & found a small crowd dancing which is what we wanted to do. For the 2 hours that we were there the DJ played danceable tunes and there was never a moment where the dance floor was empty. I had such a blast- thanks DJ!
author: Michelle M.

description:
I am a regular at Nickies who greatly appreciates the most welcoming atmosphere, great food, and tremendous service of any establishment in all of San Francisco.  

I  am most grateful that the bar is filled will fun loving, easy going, and respectful patrons.  

To you Morgan B. (Princess) - you may want to take your Mercedes to another part of town where the help assists you into safety.

Very glad that the likes of you will not return.
author: Chris K.

description:
Great place to have a beer, get some food and watch sports.

Great selection of beer and surprisingly good food. I  had:
Buffalo wings (twice) - Very good. 4.5/5
Mac and Cheese - Good flavor but was a little but has too much liquid. 3/5
Mozzarella sticks - Good flavor but came out a little soggy. Hard to mess these ups. 3/5.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: Went to see the Warriors playoff game here.  Can't say much for the food since I didn't try it.  I will say that the brunette female bartender was attentive despite the crowd circulating around the bar.  The male bartender with a pony tail was a jerk who acknowledged me but then went to another patron and took her order.  The 80's called.  They want their Michael Bolton style back.
author: Chan L.

description: Great for a group, or to watch a game and get some drinks. Great burger, good mac and cheese, decent wine, attentive service. Can't go wrong!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Did i ever tell you the time that me and my lovely girlfriend was kicked out of nickies for lighting a match??

It was about a month ago and we decided to go and check out our friend that was DJ ing there for the night. He Dj's at Nickies quite often so i thought it would be a good time. The place was packed of course and drinks as always where hard to acquire. I live a block away on waller and typically dont frequent this establishment cause of the dark interior and crappy service, But tonight solidified my reason for never coming back.

My girlfriend works as a chef at a restaurant a block away on haight and she finished her shift so i thought it would be nice to go support our friend and grab a drink after her long shift of cooking for 100s of hungry people.

We grab a beer and go sit behind the dj in the back on the right. Finally able to relax after a long day. Sitting on the table is a half used book of matches. I decided to light one with a little slight of hand trick i know. Immediately i blow it out and forget that it even happened. Suddenly a very drunk curly haired monster of a girl come stumbling up to us and says "What are you doing" , mind you thins statement sound more like "wvaaht rrrruu chewing" I asked her to repeat her drunken statement and she got pissed and said "oh no did not try and burn this place down" i said what again cause its loud and i cant believe i heard what she said.

Next thing i know she come up to us with a guy that looks like a mini asian dog the bounty hunter and his smaller, mute side kick. She points at us and says something. Suddenly i am being escorted out of the bar in a fashion that made me feel like a freaking criminal. Meanwhile my girl is livid, we just bought a beer that we didint even drink and we are being escorted out for lighting a match...Can one even be kicked out for that? i mean there are light candles on the table, should we kick them out as well?

I tried to plead my case but mini Dog kept say we caught you on camera you have to leave now. What camera? Drunk Monster was gone for 2 minutes, I highly doubt you check any camera. And what would said camera show? Me lighting a match, blowing it out, my girlfriend laughing and us having a sip of beer.

The whole situation was bullshit and handled really poorly. Obviously the Drunk curly hair monster was banging one of the bounty hunter-esq bouncers to have such, excuse the expression, weight or "pull" to have an innocent couple who just wanted to hear some music kicked out.

After getting kicked out we went to one of our favorite bars,,,Tornado, sat down at the bar and our favorite bartender came over and said he whats up guys? need a pliny. yes sir yes we do. And by the way listen to this story.

His response, "Fuck Nickies, youre beers are on me tonight."

Yes Fuck nickies indeed
author: Max E.

description: Had a really GREAT cheeseburger but the place is uncomfortably warm inside. Good selection of beer.  If it weren't for the room temperature I would return often.
author: Gloria J.

description: Best bar for Sports, drinks and food combined in Lower Haight, note however that the best Burgers you will find at Rickybobby and best sports atmosphere definitely at Mad Dog.
author: Martin L.

description:
As out-of-towners, some friends and I were interested in finding a place that offered some bottomless mimosas since I had never done that for brunch before.  Nickie's fit the bill since it was within walking distance to the Haight-Ashbury Street Fair, which we attended later in the day.  

I really want to give this place a higher rating, but I just can't because the service was not so good.  The waitress was pretty good about getting everything we asked for, but was not very friendly to us even though she was small chatting with other customers.  Maybe she was having a bad day or we did something to give her a bad vibe, but she seemed less than excited that we were there.  She even pushed her way past us to deliver a salad to a table while we were walking out.

The bottomless mimosas were great (and only $8 with a brunch purchase) and I enjoyed my eggs benedict, but their brunch menu is not super extensive.  Worth a shot if you are in the area and looking for a brunch place, but I am not so sure I will make a point of coming back here during my next trip to the city.
author: Maria K.

description:
This review is solely based on a drink(beer) and an appetizer...

I came here to watch the Celts game and to try the Mac & Cheese that my friend speaks very highly of. The server was nice & friendly.

The mac & cheese is good. It's very creamy, cheesy and it has a strong smoky flavor. I really liked it. It was also topped with a lot of bread crumbs. 

They have a special before 6pm - $5 for a burger! -must come back to try.
author: Terry C.

description:
Came for brunch on Sunday to watch the football games with some friends. It was nice to find a place that played most of the games and served brunch as we had a hard time finding places that did so. I got the corned beef hash and it was slightly different from the CBH I am used to. The corned beef tasted more like pot roast and was completely separate from any potatoes at all. Usually I am used to shredded corned beef mixed in with hashbrowns. Still tasted pretty good though. Others in our group complained that their potatoes were cold but mine were a decent temperature.

The only problem was our food took REALLY long to come out (30+ minutes) so that was annoying since we were starving.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
I have to be in the mood for beer. (Yeah, so sorry to disappoint, I guess I can never be just one of the guys with a snap of a finger.)

Unfortunately for me, a lot of the pubs/bars we passed by within one block radius of Memphis Minnies didn't have a full bar.

Except for Nickies.

Nickies is clean and roomy with a curved long bar near the entrance and lots of banquets and tables to one side.

I went with my standard G&T. I also spied lots of brown sugar on the shelf including Knob's Creek and Maker's Mark.  Draft beer lovers will be happy to know that Trumer Pils and Hoegaarden are on tap. The prices weren't absurd so we were happy about that. 

I'll keep this place in mind when I'm in the area since they have a full kitchen as well. Trivia night is every Monday.
author: Janice C.

description: Had the jambalaya--it was okay, and not as terrifyingly spicy as the friendly bartender had advised. Shame it took forever to show up as several others who arrived after I did got their food in a timely manner. Also had a couple of Anchor lagers to keep me occupied while I waited for my dinner.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I've been here several times now. I was here for a friend's birthday last year, and all the staff were very accomodating. We had a pretty large group and took up most of the back part of the bar. We had some appetizers and drinks. Great beer selection and buffalo wings. 

I've also been here for brunch. Delicious Bloody Mary's. Spicy! It also looked like they had bottomles mimosa specials. I had eggs Benedict and my gf had pancakes and bacon. Everything was reasonably priced and deliciously unhealthy. Only downside to brunch here is that there is no outdoor seating and it's very dark inside.

This place continues to be one of my favorite bars in Lower Haight.
author: Aaron S.

description:
Woah, five dollar burger before six?

We had been wandering around SF on foot all day.  People brag about the Bay weather; in my experience it is too cold for you to wear shorts but warm enough that you will sweat in pants; cold enough that you should bring a sweat shirt but warm enough that carrying the sweatshirt will feel stupid & ungainly.  Up & down hills, so maybe I was cranky from the hike of exploring the city.

Nickie's was a welcome respite.  My wife had a meeting nearby, so we & a friend ate cheap, lovely burgers, & then she took off & we explored the taps.  The selection was only so-so but the bartender was nice & friendly & eager to talk about the selection.  Also they played a bunch of the new Daft Punk album-- not the radio hits-- & I realized that I should probably actually listen to the whole album, because there are some real gems.  "Doin' It Right" is really good!  Though I guess that is the new single now?  I guess I'm not very "hip."

Anyhow, this bar was an unpretentious pub; it might get too sporty for my personal taste sometimes, but in the gaps between sport events it is great.  & hey, if you like sports stuff, you should DEFINITELY check it out.
author: Mordicai C.

description:
Normally, I'd give this place 4 stars, but it only takes one experience to ruin it. I've been here twice, and for the most part my experience has been exceptional. 

During the first game of the world series the place was packed. I had no choice but to stand somewhat in the way of the servers path, which I can admit to because there was really nowhere else to stand. I did my best to get out of the way, but one server wouldnt stand for it and seemed like she was making her mission to make sure that we knew we were in a place we shouldnt have been. If this was justified, then fine, but there were other people that were in the way just as much, or even more so than I (and my girlfriend), but for some reason she bumped shoulders with us every chance she found. 

I did my best to explain that I wasnt intentional trying to be in her way; that I was actually doing my best to get out of her way, but it seemed like she didnt care. In any case, i felt bullied. I tried hard, and she took her frustrations out on me for some reason. 

I had a bad experience, especially when the giants were winning, and I still applaud everything the rest of the bar does (especially the life-size, animated freddy krueger). I just hope that that one server (with glasses) realizes that she was pushing around someone that was really trying to help her and be accommodating in a tough situation.
author: Chris C.

description: The food here is great. Everything I have had has been very good. My friends and I come regularly during the day and are working our way through the menu.The soups are especially good, great flavors, well balanced. So glad they are in the neighborhood and moderately priced, especially for what you get- I have never left hungry.
author: Dena P.

description:
Have been to Nickies a couple of times, once on a Saturday night, and once on a Sunday during the world cup. They were completely different experiences. On the Saturday  night the place was kind of dead, so my friends and I just ended up drinking, a lot, and dancing. 

On the Sunday I got there for one of the world cup games and the place was packed! Could barely order a beer, the bar was 6 people deep and all of the tables were full! It was super fun watching the game there though. I want to check out their brunch some weekend, but I will make sure to get there super early if there is a big game on!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Love this place. Good food. Good beer. Good Sports Bar...bout as good as it gets on a Sunday for NFL. Especially if your a Denver Broncos fan. 

Let's be honest, it's San Francisco...49ers games take priority as they would in any bar anywhere in the city. And technically, it's not the 'official' Bronco bar anymore -- the meetup group moved that to the SF Athletic Club. But it doesn't matter... Week after week, the Orange Crush has continued to fill the bar come gametime, and the games are always a blast. Word to the wise, get there early. It's nearly always at capacity on a gameday. We've seen lines around the corners...and not many people leave until the games end.

The servers are frazzled from time to time... who wouldn't be in a capacity bar with limited staff? Simply put, be nice to them and they'll be nice to you. But on non-NFL game days it's easy to get in, and a mellow dive/sports bar vibe. Their breakfast is surprisingly good...as as the wings, mozzarella sticks and quesadilla.
author: David R.

description:
Authentic Irish girls serving great authentic Irish liquors and beers.  And very tasty upscale barfood - gastropub - loving it.

I've an Irish partner and it is also his favorite Irish bar in SF. Maybe its because its so friendly in the casual Haight Street area and has a great menu which includes our favorite Fried Macaroni and Cheese - of course
author: James V.

description:
Nickies is a fantastic sports bar in the Haight. It is a great place to get solid pub/bar fare and watch the game.

Most pub fare is greasy and uninspiring - Not the case @ Nickies. A group of 5 of us visited Nickies this weekend to enjoy some beers/food and cheer on USA in the Olympics.

We started with a round of beers - for a sports bar, Nickies has a surprisingly robust beer list with some niche favorites like Leffe, Shiner and Great Lakes.

For apps, we tried the buffalo wings and an order of the famous mac & cheese. The mac & cheese did not disappoint as the crunchy topping and rich smokey gouda engulfs your taste buds.

For entrees, almost everyone had burgers (beef and veggie!!!)  ONe thing is for sure, Nickies is one of the few bars who knows how to cook up a medium rare burger the right way. Too often the grills are not hot enough and as a result you get a red and grey center. Not this time, I had a nice sear on the edges and a juicy red center.

I'm looking forward to coming back to Nickies during NFL/College football season.
author: Justin O.

description:
Drinks: cheap and definitely not watered down
Food: good American menu burgers were great.
The service here rocks.
author: My A.

description: My boyfriend and I stopped for a drink on our way to the airport. We both had Jameson 7s, and they were great. I wish I could have hung out longer! The atmosphere is mellow, and inviting - the bartenders all have smiles on their faces :)
author: Cris C.

description: Great world cup venue and nice pub but what a rip off on the food. Just had nickie's scrambled eggs for $10, smallest portion ever. Should be priced at $6. Ridiculous
author: Steiner A.

description:
This place is awesome . They have the best music and drinks came fast. 
From first impression I thought that this place is not that good but boy was I wrong 
If you want to have a good time and break the routine this is the place for you
author: Mike R.

description: This is a great bar, with great service. I come in on Sundays for NFL games and always have a tremendous time. Specifically, I've been very impressed with Meghan the blonde server. She does a spectacular job. She remembers her customers, knows our drink orders, and gives it 100% all the time. The service is a major part of the reason I keep coming back! Also, they have tons of TVs, a clean, a comfortable atmosphere, and an above-average food menu. It's my favorite bar to come to for football season. Thanks Nickies! See you Sunday.
author: Andrea S.

description: If you plan on drinking at all then watch out for this place literally kicked out for having a little bit of fun! We just wanted some food after bay to breakers and we were kicked out right away, I think if you dress weird they   just don't understand!
author: Peter O.

description:
I dig this place. The food is good, the wait staff friendly, the prices acceptable, and the draught beer selection impressive for a small neighborhood bar.

For lunch, I had a turkey sandwich with fries and the sandwich, while good, was not as good as the fries.

Seating is a bit weird with tables of peculiar height. I'm told this is typical for bars in Ireland. While I can appreciate authenticity, this is America. And this is really a non-complaint.

Nickie's is good, and worth checking out if you like nearby.
author: David H.

description: good music and great selection of liquor.  however, I'm not a fan of cheap whiskey which they have.  i settled for oban 14
author: Angelica C.

description: We decided to try this place out on a Sunday morn to watch some soccer.  We were able to score a seat and were treated to great service throughout. I was suprised at the quality of the food. Definitely a step up from the norm bar food. The mozzarella sticks were packed with cheese and even got the attention of our neighbors who requested a bite. The chicken sandwich was perfectly cooked with some amazing bread used for the bun. I don't make it down to this part of town much but I'm glad we gave Nickies a try
author: Mark N.

description: Perfect weekend brunch spot. Full menu, full bar, TVs everywhere, rarely crowded (except during HUGE games).
author: Stu C.

description:
Went here for a friend's b-day brunch...with bottomless mimosas...

The atmosphere is kind of funny for brunch, it's a bar/pub...would be great for watching the game at.  There was a large group of up, 15ish so I think they did great accommodating us and gave us the whole back area.  the server was really good about getting our mimosas and keeping the glasses full....


unfortunately, me and my partner ordered food, and the kitchen must have totally forgotten it...people came after us, ordered, got their food and ate...still i did not have mine...i asked the server about it after about 40 mintues...her response was not that curteous...and then she never checked with the kitchen...2 more people inquired about my order...still no check with the kitchen and just a brief "i know" from the server...granted, the place was really busy, almost every table was full and the server was doing a great job running mimosas to us and trying to keep everything in order for a group of 15ish....but when i've ordered my food, and people have come after me, ordered the same item, received their food and ate their food while sitting right next to me...please, u should really check with the kitchen on my order...

and there was no apology.
author: Jocelyn W.

description:
During my year in the Lower Haight, I visited Nickies twice -- both for brunch over the weekend.

Nickies is a good fall-back option.  If you're walking down Haight Street without intention, or you can't get seated at nearby Kate's, you won't find any issue with the quality or the prices of the food at Nickies.  Plus, you get added pub benefits of lots of TVs and friendly staff.  Similarly, if you're looking to watch a playoff game at Mad Dog in the Fog and can't find a seat, Nickies is just down the street.

That being said, there's nothing amazing about the Nickies experience.  The food is standard Irish pub fare, and I wasn't wowed by any of the dishes that I tried.  The bottomless mimosa offering is decently priced, but don't be under any illusion that you'll be drinking any nice juice or champagne.
author: Bill H.

description: Nice chill sports bar.. Nothing to write home about but no complaints either.. Ild come back
author: Joe W.

description:
I came to Nickie's on a Friday night to have a chill night with my boyfriend and some friends. We were there early enough to get some prime seating and we snagged a table in the front. The kitchen was still open, it was around 10:30ish, so we decided to order some fish and chips.

My boyfriend and I shared the fish and chips and it was surprisingly pretty good. I wasn't expecting much but the cod was prepared well - crispy on the outside, moist and tender fish on the inside. The fries were crispy but they weren't my favorite. Overall, it was pretty good and I'd definitely order again. They also had tons of other small bites on the menu like wings, fries, calamari, chicken tenders, etc...all great for sharing.

I haven't been here to watch a game, but I definitely will keep them in mind when baseball starts up. There's tons of flatscreen tv's and plenty of tables and booths for your group.

Nickie's is a casual spot in the Lower Haight to grab a drink so if you are looking to get out of the winter cold, stop in and grab a beer and some food.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I take the bus past Nickie's on a daily basis and I totally assumed it was your average dirty bar. However, when I started venturing in on Mondays for pub trivia, I was pleasantly surprised.

Nickie's is in many ways your standard sports bar slash pub. It's dark, there's sports posters, TVs, and the like. But here's what it definitely has going for it:
--friendly staff!
--decently priced food and a great variety for a bar. Appetizers are good and as unhealthy as you'd like, however there are some salad options. I like the calamari and the nachos will totally give you a heart attack. In a good way (?).
--Their pub trivia on Monday is really fun. I used to go to Mad Dog in the Fog on Tuesdays or Thursdays from time to time, but it was always REALLY crowded and loud. Which is fun in and of itself, but at Nickie's, it's never too crowded or too loud to hang out and have a good time while doing trivia. It's very casual and a good place to hang out on Mondays if you want to get your trivia on.

I enjoy this place.
author: Courtney A.

description:
If it weren't for the Cranky Waitress with Dirty Blonde Curly/Wavy Hair and Glasses, I think this bar would have a lot of potential. Her attitude was such a buzzkill. A group of us came here for a friend's bday. One of us brought in an outside drink - consisting of an almost-empty plastic cup of water. Once we sat down, she says "no drinks allowed" with no smile, no explanation, no apologies, and proceeds to throws it away. When we told her it was only water, she glares and says "even water." After that, it just went downhill. I don't think I saw her crack one smile the entire time we were there. And the bar was almost empty...

I see another person below had a similar experience with her. You know, it won't kill you to smile, be nice, and even say "thank you." Smiles are free, and it might actually help you get a decent tip. 

The bar is actually pretty nice, and I would come here again, but not if I have to subjected to her as my waitress. Thanks for ruining our night.
author: Kim C.

description: All old people on a Friday night.  Cray
author: Fatty A.

description:
I am editing my previous review (below) because it's probably not fair to ding an entire establishment for one employee's miss-step and one slow day. Though the miss-step could've ended up in 10+ people standing outside of Nickie's trying to figure out where to go, had I not gone the day before and figured out that they were going to be closed. The manager called a few hours before our reservation when she realized the mistake, and I would've been able to catch a few people in time...

Overall:
I've been here a number of times and the staff is friendly and the clientele generally welcoming a fun. It's a good place to watch a game because there are a lot of TVs (gets crowded during bigger games, but this is to be expected). Plus, there's food. The mac and cheese is usually good - has smoked gouda which is a good touch. 

____________________
Previous Post:

I called today to ask if I could reserve a table for the Sugar Bowl tomorrow. The woman on the phone asked me how many and my name. I told her. I went in to watch the end of some games, and there were signs all over the bar that said that they were closed on "Tuesday, January 3rd". I asked one of the waitresses, and she said that they were definitely closed. I tried to plan ahead to have a group of friends watch a game, and now I have to make sure that none of them show up tomorrow to a closed bar. Very bad Nickies....FIGURE OUT YOUR SCHEDULE AND TELL YOU EMPLOYEES BEFORE A BUNCH OF PEOPLE SHOW UP!!!!!  Plus, it took an hour for our food to show up today, and the mac and cheese was super runny and had zero taste.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I've been coming here for over a year. Before you slam the waitress or bar staff, try sparking up a conversation.  They are ALL cool folks. Perhaps it might be YOU that is having the bad day! I love everyone that works here! 

-- that said --

Great place & Great food. I wish that the 10 dollar steak and mashed potato deal was always available. I would come here just for that alone. 

Nickies - where the Fernet flows like beer and sports fans flock like the salmon of Capistrano.

The best part of Nickies: DENVER BRONCOS BAR!
author: Jake S.

description: Love this place for game watching of all fancies! Especially love it for the great Bartender Vee, super fun always makes me happy! Grade A burger for $5!!! You can't beat that. Jambalaya is fantastic. Nachos are huge. Large booths for cuddling while watching several games from one of there many TVs. Im definitely a repeat offender here. One con... When it's hot out this place is almost unbearable. Needs better ventilation. But it's so rarely that way in SF so 5 stars!
author: Molly A.

description: I like this bar - doesn't smell, great bartenders, tons of regular patrons who hang to shoot the shit, and last but not least, the curry fries :)
author: Wakako U.

description:
Mad Dog....you are on notice. 

You might have some competition. Granted, they don't sell replica jerseys but then again, I already got my Forlan gear. 

While we saw the 3rd Place game on Saturday at MDITF, the place was packed on Sunday for the less impressive Dutch v Spanish Mixed Martial Arts game. So we wandered over the Nickies. 

No required $10 at door or having to squirm out to an ATM that wasn't broken....BIG plus. 

Despite a full crowd for the WC Final, I got served insanely quickly. 

I will definitely be coming back to Nickies for big games.
author: Mike V.

description: PBRs cost $4 here. It's hot as balls. All of the tables are reserved. They have more televisions than people under 30. Don't bother.
author: Nat T.

description:
Came in around 11:30 Sunday for brunch. 

The food prices are very expensive and the brunch food was terrible. There was maybe 10 of us and between us, ordered every egg dish on the menu and every single egg was cook heavily in oil. The eggs were lack any flavor and were so greasy it was gross. Why not butter? Why not butter flavored spray? A restaurant that can't cook eggs correctly has a lot to learn. 

My boyfriend got the grilled salmon and said it was very good although we had to ask for lemons. Wish I got something off their lunch menu. 

I give them two stars for having Shiner Bock on tap :)
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Great example of a neighborhood bar that has morphed into a local sports bar. TVs everywhere since Nickie's doesn't have the big-box shape or feel of a traditional suburban sports bar. The beers on tap taste quite fresh, and they pour the best Newcastle pints I've ever had. Turns out that their website claims to have some kind of unique tap system. Alls I know is....no skunky tasting drafts, and I've had five different beers on draft there. Nickie's is now my go-to sports bar for big games.

The mix of people is both laid-back and fun/upbeat thanks to background-not-foreground music, usually from a DJ (iTunes?). Depending on the time of night you'll see more or less serious drinkers, people just hanging out, and the occasional family, all co-existing well. Yes, parents in the neighborhood will bring their children on occasion during the early parts of the evening or weekends. I don't have kids but I watched a college basketball game last night with my friend of 25 years, her two kids and mom, who was visiting from OOT. My friend's the person who'd recommended Nickie's in the first place since they live nearby.

The same person waited on my table for each of my two visits. She isn't necessarily smiley but she's pretty effective. Four of the five of us ordered burgers but we didn't get our Wed night $5 burger special in on time, just after 6pm. We weren't organized enough but you'll have that. Fortunately though, our server stepped for us and corrected the kitchen to take back 3 of the burger orders before serving them to us...so thanks to her!

I expected a five-star burger after the server said, "The fried chicken is great....The burgers are kind of famous around here." It wasn't all that IMO, but to my eyes it appeared to be a grinded and hand-formed patty. I wish it'd been cooked medium and not medium rare, but finally....a burger in SF that isn't OVERcooked! 

At half a pound, it dominates the toppings and sesame seed bun. Love the sesame seed bun!  All of the ingredients tasted fresh, including the patty. The fries were good too, with coarse salt and herbs. The alternative to fries, cole slaw, was thick and worked well on the burger as an extra topping; it tasted almost like it was mixed w bleu cheese.
author: Mike H.

description: Mmm mozzarella sticks. Food is good. Drinks are good. I'll try a more adventurous cocktail next time.
author: Heather R.

description:
Cheap, bottomless mimosas. Was here Sunday morning and there was hardly anyone here taking advantage of the amazing prices and decent fare. Our server kept the refills coming on our bottomless mimosas and she was so pleasant!
I was here for a $6 cheeseburger and my server even substituted garlic fries for me, no charge! Amazing. They were so good. Granted, I could taste garlic for days, it was WORTH IT.

Cheap draft beers, too. I think a buck or two off at happy hour. I paid $10 for a giant cheeseburger with amazing garlic fries and a beer before tax and tip. But make sure to get there before 6! Deals end there. If you can't, not to worry. Burgers are only about $10 and beers are maybe $5 or $6. Still reasonable.
author: christine c.

description: Great bar.  It's relatively nice, the staff is friendly (a rarity in SF) and the food is good.  This place is also great for watching sports as they have a ton of TVs.  Definitely worth checking out.
author: Ravi R.

description:
Dear Cranky Waitress with Dirty Blonde Curly/Wavy Hair and Glasses,

I don't expect 5 star service at a bar, but getting annoyed that the bar is well populated and you might have to step around some people doesn't warrant SHOVING PEOPLE OUT OF THE WAY.  If you could keep your eye rolling and assaulting to yourself I might come back because it seems like a cool bar.  I'm sorry the respectful people who pay you tips were too much of an inconvenience for you.

Hope you have a better day tomorrow.

Marie
author: Marie B.

description: I was really disappointed after a recent visit to Nickies. We used to go when we moved here a couple years ago and loved the standard pub food and friendly service. The new menu looks amazing, but, unfortunately, does not live up to the hype. The portion sizes were very small and the ingredients looked like they had just been slapped together on a plate. Not only was the food we had mediocre, but half the menu was unavailable (3 out of 5 of the appetizers we wanted to share were out), and the waitress told us this about 20 minutes after we placed our order which meant our food was even more delayed. Sorry to say that we aren't going back - not worth it. We miss the old Nickies.
author: Saman A.

description:
I went here on a Saturday early afternoon.  From the time myself and my friend sat down to when we got our drink was almost 20 minutes.  The waitress was super cranky - f'ing excuse me for ordering a drink at your bar.  My friend got calamari - it was the worst calamari ever. Disgusting.  I have no idea why I'd go here again when there are so many better options nearby. 

I left a tip, but not nearly as good as I normally do.  I didn't deduct tip due to the food being crappy, but noted on the receipt that the waitress was a rude and cranky as hell so that's why she didn't get a full tip.

No need to go back here at all.
author: Allison M.

description:
