Stopped for a bloody mary - and it was killer. I was suspicious when the Irish bartender dumped Guinness into it... But she was totally right.

Chill atmosphere - highly recommended for wrekend hangover maintenance
author: Brian M.

description: One of the worst places I have ever been to eat! Sent the food back, cold and horrible. Good for only if want a semi cold beer. I think our server was on LSD. Sooooo bad!
author: Austin L.

description:
A solid bar experience with delicious special cocktails!!! 

With my friend's birthday bar crawl approaching 20 people, we decided to go to Nickies. Luckily, the rain seemed to keep a lot of people home and the whole back booth area behind the DJ was free for us to use!! Their cocktails all sounded super tasty but I ended up going with the "71 Haight," a delightful concoction of vodka, pineapple juice and grenadine. Girly? Yes. Deliciously potent? Oh yeah. 
The space was welcoming and the music fairly good. Had a blast getting the birthday girl drunk.

One qualm I had was the two bartenders made my 71 Haights very different (yes I had two). They were both good, but oh-so-different. Oh well, I'll drink either for $6!!
author: Rayna L.

description:
Woah, this place sure got a make-over.  We used to say turning this way on Haight from Fillmore was the "wrong way" to go if you value your life and sanity.  This bar used to be really, really sketchy, with Grateful Dead nights, drug party extravaganzas and a generally pretty dirty and creepy vibe all around.

I am happy to report that Nickie has cleaned up her act, and gone from high school drop-out to enrollment in community college, now working above the counter (but not on the counter).

Sweet and friendly bartenders mix very nice cocktails, which complement the great bar food they now serve.  I'm a fan of the Mini Niman Ranch Burgers and the Mac and Cheese.  I like to fancy it up with a well-poured dirty martini.

Nicely done Nickie.  I would even consider introducing you to my parents now.
author: Ravena F.

description:
Don't go here. This place sucks. I want to keep it all to myself. Wait, was that last sentence out loud? Crap.

Nickies. Is. Awesome. An unexpected gem in the Haight, it's arguably the cleanest sports bar in SF with a great beer/drink selection and hands down, some of the best mac and cheese in the city. Smoked gouda?! Yes please!! Their other food is good too, but the mac and cheese is addictive. My friend wanted to start showing up with tupperware so she could bring it home (seriously, I hope she does it so I can steal the tupperware from her).

Go to Nickies (but I'd really prefer if you didn't so I could keep it all to myself!).
author: Shachi B.

description:
Stopped in for a quick beer. Chatted with some regulars, learned a bit about the place's history and had another beer.

I'd go back anytime.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Nickie's is great! $5 burgers during the day, great draft selection, and super chill bartenders, they don't seem to have as much attitude as some of the others on this street.

It also seems to be a little less crowded then some of the other local spots, where I can actually grab a seat at the bar and not have to wait forever for a beverage. Sometimes the drunks don't want to stumble an extra block away, and stay down by mad dog or moltovs or toronado...good!
author: Meowy C.

description: Great place to have a few drinks and hang out with friends! Theres a Dj on certain nights and he plays great music. It's a great place to enjoy a few beers and have a great time
author: Citlali G.

description:
We stopped in for the $5 burger deal at lunch.  The burger was tasty and the fries were perfectly cooked.  The coleslaw was unusual but the best part of the meal.  The coleslaw includes green apples and blue cheese.  I am not a big blue cheese fan but it is a perfect combination.  

The waitress/bartender could not care less that there were people sitting at the bar. She was completely apathetic.  She didn't notice that the drinks were empty and when the bill came she overcharged us.  

This lousy service will not keep me from enjoying this burger combo again.
author: Megan P.

description:
Went here for the first time to watch the NCAA Final Four games and it was packed, but not overwhelming - someone was having their birthday party at the same time so another 20 - 30 people that might not have been there. 

Had drinks and appetizers for four people and it came out to only ~$80 before tips. This is probably one of the best prices I've seen given their drink & food selection.

One negative for me was that the wings I ordered were raw (first-time this has ever happened to me) but told the waitress and she quickly took them away and brought another plate that was fully cooked and did not charge me for it.

Even with this incident - I'll still be coming back.
author: Dai T.

description:
WOW this place sure has changed!!!

Back in the day Nickies was a fairly sketchy dance club with kind of a weird reputation. 

A while back a friend wanted to scout it out as a potential place to view world cup matches. I didn't know where he got the idea to but I went along and boy was I surprised at the transformation. Someone turned it into a high end gastro-pub and sports bar. It's an entirely new place with the same old name.

It's not really my kind of place but I'd go back in a pinch.
author: Manny F.

description: Stopped here as part of our pub crawl on a Saturday night and it was a great spot! It had a cool, casual vibe. They also poured some decent drinks. The location is very convenient to other spots as well as restaurants.
author: Tammy S.

description:
I like sitting down as much as the next dude, I also like baseball as much as the next guy.  But an average bar is going to get an average score. 

Beer selection is acceptable.  But not worth staying for round two.  Much prefer Toronado or even Mad Dog over this joint.
author: Beef E.

description:
Our group decided to start the New Year off with a bang. The best we knew how was with a well balanced meal - brunch. Our waitress recommended that we try the Nickie's burger and their breakfast burrito. So, we marched to the beat of her drum. She took our order and then the wait began. Part of it could have been our unrivaled hunger, but our meal took exceptionally long even on a busy day. At least our waitress was having a great time while we waited. And by that I mean she was taking shots with a table she was serving. Once our food arrived, we found it to be less than ideal. The burger was covered in mayo (top and bottom), which was surprising as the menu did not indicate that condiment at all. Honestly, who puts mayo on a burger? I debated asking her to bring fresh buns, but then realized that task might take longer than the food did. The breakfast burrito was subpar at best. There was so much tortilla that the only way to describe its consistency was that of a rock. Oh and the thawed-out veggie burger was paper thin and tasteless.

In conclusion, let's just say the coffee was the best part of the meal.
author: Gabe S.

description: Best mac & cheese in town.  We always like to go in the afternoon when it's not crowded so we can sit there for two hours and savor it with Guinness.
author: Raina M.

description:
A friend and I decided to come to Nickies on a Saturday night for some drinks.  This was my first time here.  The bar is decent in size and has a lot of flat screens for watching sports.  Surprisingly, they even had the University of Hawaii football game playing.  

The crowd was the Lower Haight type and the place has a good vibe.  They also have a decent beer selection and some of your standard Irish beers for an good price.  I ordered a few glasses of Guinness, but didn't have a chance to order food.  Based on my first experience there, I'll have to give Nickies 4 stars, especially for the good jams that were playing all night.
author: Shad B.

description:
This review is strictly for their buffalo wings.

There were two reasons I decided to join yelp so I could leave a review and this was one of them. 

I consider myself a buffalo wing aficionado.  I spent 2 years in Boston and while I was there I went on a quest to find the best buffalo wings in the north east.  I traveled from Maine to Rhode Island to Buffalo NY testing wings at places people recommended.  I was testing purely on "Buffalo Wing" not honey hot, bbq, teriaki, etc..

When I moved back home to the bay area I still had my craving for buffalo wings but everywhere I tried I felt like the wings were sub par.  too bready, not good sauce, not enough meat, etc...

This was until I found Nickies.  This place got the formula right.  Their wings have a great buffalo sauce, nice and crispy but the meat on the inside is very tender.  Apparently, cause I asked in a buffalo wing induced haze, they soak the chicken wings is some sort of flavored water (rosemary, salt, other spices), then boil the wings in that water, then fry them.  Its an incredible mix which rates these wings the BEST BUFFALO WINGS I have had in SF so far.

Ill keep people updated as I find more.  Long live the wing.

- David
author: David H.

description: Was pleased to see there is a Bronco bar in SF!  Had a great vibe and nice feel to it, didnt have that bar smell like some of those other Lower Haight Irish pubs...I'll be back for more Broncos watching!
author: Trent S.

description: I came here this past Sunday to watch the Bronocos game. There's a group of Broncos fans that come here to watch all the games and I think it's awesome that Nickie's supports that. Nice selection of beers on tap, AWESOME hot wings. My only complaint is I wish there was at least one bigger TV, they're all pretty tiny but one huge tv or projecter would make up for that.
author: Meagan R.

description:
Divine!

Came here one foggy morning with my BF and was totally blown away! They have definitely re-done the inside as it is a classssy establishment. There was only one other couple in the whole place but they had all the TV's on with different games which we enjoyed. 

Out server was ok, maybe hungover from Saturday, but nice enough. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros and it was probably the best I have ever had! Everything came separate..the eggs, salsa, so much avocado, beans and meat, so I got to make it myself. It was seriously TO DIE FOR. Also ordered a mimosa, $8 for bottomless..thank you!

My BF went the healthy route, (trying to make me look bad) and ordered the Fruit Plate which looked great as well. Tons of fresh fruit and berries. He also got some toast and coffee which was good...pretty basic. 

But...the Huevos Rancheros are awesome!!

This is definitely a must-do on Hight Street and if there is a line of hipsters at Katies Kitchen...be smart and go to Nickies!
author: Alissa C.

description: Go to Nickie's for Denver Bronco gamedays. Waitstaff treats us awesome. Always a fun crowd. Menu hits all the right spots. CO transplants are always welcomed here.
author: Chad S.

description:
I do not watch football on Sundays. I rarely go to bars in the middle of the day, let alone eat bar food.

And yet.... this Sunday I found myself happily munching on a smokin' chipotle chicken breast sandwich (yes, that's what it's called on the menu).

I asked for chipotle sauce on the side because I didn't want the sandwich drenched with it, and I also asked for a side of bleu cheese dressing to dip my fries in. I was granted both.

The fries were super tasty and might have had some garlic on them... delicious. The sandwich came on really nice, crunchy bread. I was shocked that bar food was so good and not greasy at all. 

And so, I have to admit the truth: Nickies is a pretty decent place to be... if you choose to be inside on a Sunday afternoon watching sports instead of out enjoying the city.
author: Hannah L.

description:
I started coming to Nickies as I heard about the bottomless mimosas. Now, I'm NOT a fan of the Sports Bar. I don't really watch sports (other than the occasional soccer match) and could do without all the big-screen TVs and hollerin' fellas. 

Still, I put Nickies on my go-to list for brunch + aforementioned bottomless mimosas. The food is decent (overcooked poached eggs aside), and the drinks are strong. 

The BEST thing about Nickies is the bathroom (only reviewing the women's bathroom, of course). It's lovely and clean and nothing like a pub loo.

The WORST thing about Nickies is one of the waitresses who never cracks a smile and is seemingly humorless. Still, she's pretty, so whatevs!

So yeah, I'm a fan!
author: Mi M.

description: I've been meaning to write an update review to this place, because my last review was really about a one-off bad experience. We have come to Nickies a lot since then for football games and just to hang and I really enjoy the place. I also got a really nice message from the male bartender who I mentioned in my last review who explained his point of view on the mix-up in a really professional and nice way. So, it looks like that was a misunderstanding. I much appreciated the message!
author: Erin B.

description:
Recently moved to the Duboce Triangle/ Lower Haight area from back East.    Popped into Nicki's for a beer the other day to try to start feeling out all the joints in close proximity.  Positive verdict.

It's a good space ( i like dark wood bars), decent beer list, decent food.  A bar.  It has TV's.  It has burgers.  Basically, you know what you're getting- and sometimes that's exactly what you want.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Nickies
466 Haight Street
San Francisco, CA 94117-3506
(415) 255-0300
http://www.nickies.com/

Date: 12/2/2010
Eater: Charlie

Price: $12 (on the menu) Niman Ranch burger with Tillamook Cheddar, Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onion, garlic aioli and fries. For some undetermined reason, I was charged only $6 for the burger...needless to say, I did not push the kind waitress to explain this discrepancy. Maybe it was Happy Hour? Again, I didn't want to push my luck. The most likely explanation I could come up with, was that the Burger Gods were looking kindly down on me, after the Heat thumped my Cavs that same evening.

Now to be completely honest, when I walked into Nickies in the lower Haight I had no intention of (1) Eating their burger or (2) reviewing their burger. This was a divey, sports bar/Irish pub; what would they know about burgers?! As I scanned the short brew pub menu, I noticed in big bold letters: Niman Ranch Burger. My interest was piqued; Niman Ranch, burger you say? I read on. 1/2 pound burger. ok. ok. Topped with Tillamook Cheddar. Waitress! I was hooked.

I must admit, this was a solid burger and at $6, it was a steal. Again, the burger was pink throughout - just the way I like it - and the garlic aioli (a great touch) added a complimentary taste and texture to the burger. They didn't dump the garlic aioli on the burger either (a la True Burger). The Tillamook was a nice, mild cheddar that didn't overwhelm the burger or the taste buds. The bun, un-toasted, was good but nothing special. The kind waitress didn't know from where it came...other than to say "from the bin."

The fries were very good as well; every last one having a nice crunch and/or crispness (whichever adjective you prefer to use to describe good fries) as Jenn could attest, as she "helped" me finish each and every one.


Size: 1/2lb.
Ranch: Niman Ranch
Meat: Cow

Beer with Burger: Trumer Plisner draft: $6


Beer Availability: A fairly large - 15 draft beers and 15 bottled beers - but uncreative beer list.

Ambiance: Nickies seemed like a great place to watch sports - flatscreens were peppered throughout the bar - and drink. I'm sure it's packed Saturdays and Sundays for college and professional football. It's fairly clean, although not sterile, for a sports bar.

Burger Rating: 1 standard deviation above the mean.
author: Charlie R.

description: Great bar in the lower Haight. Decent food (Mac n Cheese, Jambalaya). Good drinks selection. Friendly staff and a nice mix of regulars. Good music including an odd Irish Trad Session.
author: L W.

description:
I'm not sure what this place used to be, but what it is now is really good.

It's basically an upscale Irish Sports Bar.  

This is something lacking in San Francisco, which is basically on every corner in New York City.  There is a restaurant called the Joshua Tree in NYC, and a number of Irish Pubs which are just like this place, and it is SOOO needed in this city.

They have very comfortable seating, and different levels so you can watch a game in a smaller environment as well as the main floor.  

I like that some of the employees are actually Irish, and everyone I've met there is nice.  

They have all the NFL games, college, etc.  Many large HD TVs, and good site lines all around.  Again, best bar for games that I've been too when you factor in comfort too.  Not sure if they show EPL and La Liga soccer, but they'll put anything on if they're open.

Their beer prices are VERY GOOD.  I think a Carlsberg, which is hard to find, is around $4.  

Plus they have these REALLY GOOD BURGER DEALS for like $5 before 6pm, or something like that, with Fries (also good).  Everything I've eaten there I've liked.  Girlfriend is vegetarian, and she can eat there as well.

I had fish tacos there which were surprisingly good.  I've had them at Kezar as well (and Taquerias), and these were better.

I've been there for breakfast/brunch twice, and again, surprisingly good!

2 Downsides:

You have a few odd balls in there from time to time, especially because of the cheap burger deals.  They talk to themselves, and sometimes you, but after all this is San Francisco.

And the bar completely transforms around 10pm on the weekend nights into some kind of Asian Club.  Maybe it just happened to be the 3 times I was there, but there was definitely a DJ, and definitely a lot of Asians.  I'm not against any groups, but it was overwhelmingly obvious.  So, the "knock" is the club part, not the Asians.  But for a second I thought it was "Asians Drink Free Night."
author: David W.

description: A Vancouverite in SF, I came here to catch game 7 of the Stanley Cup final.  I was there for the TV's and beer and not expecting much from the food, but I was pleasantly surprised.  Mac and cheese was creamy and delicious, and the spinach salad was full of bacon-y goodness.  4 beers and 2 entrees came to a very reasonable $30.  If the Canucks ever make it to the final again (say, in another 17 years) I'll be back.
author: Andrea P.

description:
Sports bars aren't really my thing, but if you're just getting drinks you could do worse.  They have Shiner Bock on tap which is always appreciated and the barstaff/waitresses are all awesome.  Unfortunately the kitchen has failed me one too many times.  My last three meals here have consisted of 

1) An $8 blt on untoasted bread cut into four pieces with so little bacon on it that one of the pieces didn't have ANY bacon it it.  That's right, it was a lettuce and tomato sandwich.

2) Irish bacon and cabbage that was COLD and the cabbage was horribly undercooked

3) Fried chicken that was so overcooked and dry that it was nearly black served with cold mash

Add too this the ripoff appetizer prices and you have a sports bar where ordering anything that isn't in liquid form is a bad idea.  Which is a damned shame because otherwise it's a pretty cool joint.
author: Joshua W.

description:
I'll be the first to admit it: I judge books by their covers. When I'm browsing titles at a Borders, I completely discriminate and pick up novels that have appealing cover designs. So when I saw that bold and bright neon green "N" lighting up the Lower Haight, I said to myself: "I want to go to there." And I did. 

Nickies is where I ended up on my birthday. Recently relocated to The Low-Hai (as we locals call it*), I wanted to experience its true character on the most important day of the year**(which is closely followed by MLK Jr. Day, Thanksgiving and E(l/r)ection Day). 

After a satisfying dinner at rnm, we walked 3 blocks down to Nickies which sounded like it was bumpin' from outside. Soon as I stepped inside, I knew I made the best decision of my life. There was a DJ in the back room who was mostly playing 90s R&B and hip-hop music (aka my favorite music for any DJ to play at any bar). Give me some Snoop and Babyface and my heart will melt. 

The bar is like a cleaned up & modern version of any ol' Irish pub / sports bar. It's like the blonde guy from Queer Eye*** came in and said "let's keep the motif you have going here, but just ^SPICE^ it up with some 2010." Wood paneling, booths with chairs and long (but not narrow). Lots of beers, liquor and wine for a diverse bar-going crowd. They apparently have good food too... I saw the nachos come out and I wanted to taste but thought it unfit for a gentleman such as myself to engage in such a dasterly deed. 

I like this bar because it's 2 blocks from my apartment. I like this bar because they know how to keep it real. I like this bar because Nickie is the name of a girl I had a crush on in middle school who was into art and dyed a streak of her blonde hair in koolaid. And finally, I like this bar because it validated my belief in judging things by their cover. 


________
*No one calls it that
**Tauruses rule
***Fact: I've actually never seen a full episode of that show****
****But I have seen the show where he's judging future sexytime models who are secretly taped to see if they're beautiful on the inside (/puke)
author: Jared S.

description:
The staff here is awesome. Every one of them. Great place to come throw back a few pints and a few shots, watch a game, talk to some friendly folks. Occasionally there's some crappy music on, but that's easily fixable with one of those internet jukebox things.

The food here is also pretty good for being pub food. It's alot better than the pub food at some of the other local bars.Also, you can't forget about their $5.00 burger deal they got going on everyday. It's pretty sweet. 

Over all solid bar in the lower haight.
author: Joe M.

description: Great place to watch a Broncos game ...
author: Joanna K.

description: My favorite place to have a burger or beef nachos, a drink and enjoy DJ Icue spin all of my favorite music videos (Friday and/or Saturday nights). Everyone is nice, the crowd is very mixed and chill (no meat market club vibe, yuck), there is no cover and no dress code. Perfect for just hanging out with friends after a long week.
author: Vee O.

description: Came here for an app and drink while waiting for Ricky Bobbys to open. They have great Friday happy hour deals with a $5 menu. Got the sausage and veggie skewer with rice- it was pretty good. The rice was really creamy, almost like a risotto which was different but very flavorful. Service was good
author: Kajal G.

description: Went there to meet some friends had a wonderful nights fun there the bartender was Geraldine ,she was great a wonderful personality,and mixed good stiff drinks.will defiantly be going back,our new go to Irish bar.
author: Paula C.

description:
I worked at a number of bars when I was in college.  

I worked the door usually (don't let the pretty face fool you, if shit's going down, I am the fastest to hover in a corner and dial 911).

We had two dreaded nights that we absolutely hated working.

1) Summer Solstice.  For some reason, the people of Santa Barbara feel the need to party when it's officially summer.  

2) Saint Patrick's Day.  

What do both of these nights have in common?

They are both dubbed "rookie night" by the local staffers.  

Rookie night in that you will find an abnormal number of non-social drinkers.  Those that live to drink once or twice a year and have no idea how to do it right.

These people get bellegerent beyond belief.  

Take note.  Does your local watering hole suddenly switch to plastic cups on St. Patty's day?  

It's not because they weren't aware of this swelling tide of customers.  

It's because they have learned, from experience, that Barb, from accounting, is going to shatter at least three wine and cocktail glasses on her quest to get liquored up enough to tolerate sex with her dirtbag husband.

I've been to Nickies a few times and it's one of my regular stops in the lower haight.  

It'll most likely be one of the many stops I make this St Patty's Day as I, let me talk like most of my younger cousins talk for a second, own some noobs while I enjoy an adult beverage or two.

Veteran.
author: Archie R.

description:
+Good bar food (i recommend the mac n cheese and fish and chips)
+Good music
+Comfortable decor and setting

-Grumpy waitress
author: Emy s.

description:
If you come into Nickies and they have New England Clam Chowder on the specials board, order it immediately! And then treat yourself to the Mac & Cheese. Seriously people...it's awesome. 
Love the relaxed vibe and you feel at home here, even if you've only been here once.
thanks nickies
author: laura s.

description:
Some of the cheapest bar eats in town and its good too. Slightly less crowded and cheaper than Mad Dog down the street and play all kinds of good sports.

I usually head there on Saturday or Sunday morning to watch football and drink bottomless mimosas from 10-2. Its only 8 bucks. Their house DJs are pretty solid as well.
author: Julian Q.

description:
Welcome to fried food heaven. 

I can't come here without ordering the Potato Skins, but I've tried friends' Fish n' Chips, Garlic Cheese Fries, and Fried Chicken. If you want pub food, this is it. Great drafts and bottles too. 

Wait staff is very very nice, although the food comes out sloooowww. It's like you have to earn the food by being patient. 

Still, yummmmm.
author: Alyssa G.

description: This place is a gem! The drinks are strong, the food is delicious, and the staff is amazing.
author: Ryan S.

description: A fun sports bar with good food and good enough drinks (though their cocktails are a bit weak). A fun place to watch a football game, though.
author: Ryan S.

description: While the food was good, the service here was awful. It took 20 minutes to even get a drink order in. Once we put in our food order, about 25 minutes later- we were advised that the items we ordered were no longer available(which is when most would expect their food to be out). We got bottomless mimosas that were not refilled unless asked and we had to ask for our check from the bartender because another 30 minutes after eating, it still hadn't come.  Worst experience in San Fran.
author: Tracy M.

description: I watched a football game here on Sunday with an out-of-town guest. We had brunch (delicious breakfast burrito -- ask for one with avocado), beverages (fantastic Bloody Mary, just the right strength), and were able to get some work done as well, thanks to the free Wi-Fi. The wait staff was super attentive despite a high-maintenance and hungry crowd. It's a great spot for watching football with friends -- definitely on my list of faves for activities of this type.
author: Ann H.

description:
Clearly a sports bar, as it was quite under capacity when we came at midnight on a Saturday.  I searched for good dancing spots within walking distance of my apt, and Nickies seemed promising....WRONG.

First off, only having 10-15 people at midnight on a weekend was the first warning sign.  The music was also old-school hip-hop/rap which is all fine and good, but not particularly dance-able.  The DJ also did not play our (old school hip hop) requests.  How about something with a beat?  It was also loud enough to make conversation difficult.
author: Cathy Y.

description:
This was my go-to spot to watch the Baltimore Ravens every Sunday during football season. They have NFL Sunday Ticket and it's easy to grab a TV if you get there at 10 (when they open and pretty close to kickoff time). The waitstaff is friendly and attentive and it doesn't start to get crowded until closer to noon. 

Tasty brunch specials and bottomless mimosas for $5 helped me forget how weird it was to watch football at 10am instead of at 1pm with beer and wings.
author: Asheley W.

description:
Racer 5? Check.
Football? Check.
Willing to play the Buffalo Bills games? Check.

That's enough for me. I've spent waaaay too many Monday nights and Sundays wasting away in here, cringing through every second of the painful experience that is watching a Bills game. At least trusty old racer 5 can make it seem less cruel.

I love that every time I'm here, I end up talking to the people next to me at the bar. So many places you go to and are totally isolated off in your own little group, but here everyone seems to want to get to know each other. It's something I really miss about the other cities I've lived in, and something that hardly ever happens to me in The City.

The food is okay. Not my favorite ever, but it's always nice to be able to nosh a bit while imbibing. The jambalaya was pretty good, and the chicken tenders somehow end up making their way to my table more often than I'd like to admit. Happy hour offers serveral appetizers at $5/each (chicken quesadillas, fries, etc.) and $3.50 or $4ish beers. 

I just can't justify the 5th star because as much as I hate to say it, I really can't stand it here on most weekend nights. The blaring techno/hip-hop music just doesn't do it for me. The music gets way too loud to hear anyone and the atmosphere's not as chill as the normal vibe.
author: Monica C.

description:
So Nickie's is a sports bar. Take it for what  it is. You go there to get drink/food while watching sports. This is not the spot you come to to be seen or be too cool. I like Nickie's for what it is. If I want to go watch the ball game and I'm hungry and I have my dog with me then I come to NIckie's because besides having many large flat panel TVs everywhere they also have good tasty food AND they're dog friendly....AND the service is good. 

Lower Haight seems to have a few Irish-style bars - Danny Coyle's, Mad Dog int he Fog, Nickie's...which boggles my mind. I would never think Irish pubs and Lower Haight would go together but somehow it does.

Mind you I've only come here twice and it's been during the week. Weekends might be a different case.
author: David C.

description:
3.5?

service: awesome. our waitress was honest, kind, fun, and accomodating

food: nothing extraordinary. we had the mac and cheese, chicken tenders, buffalo wings, and steak quesadillas. everything was fine. nothing was bad but nothing was super "to die for"

drinks: i had a drink that was similar to a manhattan? but shaken and in a martini glass. nice, strong, and happy drink :)

i would come back. it's really dark but the music is fun and people are sweet. no, it's not a five star restaurant. but who wants that on haight street? ;)
author: Christine N.

description: This place is nothing like I thought it would be - in a very good way. I anticipated a pretty dive-y bar that wasn't very crowded, and I was pleasantly surprised. The bar is amazingly clean, and very well kept. The staff is super friendly and the music is always upbeat and catchy. It's a great place to go with a group and grab a booth. We were here in the afternoon after brunch, so we didn't eat, but their menu looks amazing. I'm definitely coming back again in the near future for brunch - apparently word of mouth is they have the cheapest mimosas and the best food in town. Time will tell :)
author: Lauren D.

description: Stopped by for a drink with a friend. We sat at the bar. Their music was excellent; it was my ipod playlist and it made me happy (even though it kept getting louder as the night went on). Good service, and we had a good time for a weeknight.
author: Sneha P.

description: Five dollar burger with fries on weekdays from 12-6. Pretty tasty and one of the best deals.
author: Julie B.

description: stopped in to Nikki's for a few drinks this place was clean had a good atmosphere of people transferred good would definitely go again
author: Albert T.

description: Will never come here again EVER! Horrible horrible horrible customer service. I came here during World Cup and it was a big mistake. The place was full when I arrived and they informed me that I wasn't allowed to enter. I told them that my friend had saved a seat for me but the rude door guy still wouldn't budge stating the spiel of "we are over capacity" etc. So then when my friend talked to them pointing to the free empty seat next to him the door guy remained unfazed and just continued denying people in unless someone left the bar. So I stood outside for about 30 mins or so waiting to get in when I should have just left. If it weren't for my friends being inside I would have left immediately. Anyways, while I was waiting I overheard some really nasty conversation between one of the waitresses/hostess and the door guy. This is what she said and yes I quote you there are her exact words. Keep in mind that she was about five feet away from me so I could hear everything. "If these dumb fucks would have arrived early for the game then they wouldn't have problem finding a seat. Rude people." WOW!!! That's crazy! I think that waitress needs to get fired for sure. She has zero manners and skills. Lastly the door guy is as much of an idiot as the waitress as he let in some random groups of people who had gotten there AFTER me saying "My boss is allowing me to let these people in. If the boss says it's ok then it's ok. Gotta follow boss's orders." What are you like 12? If your manager was smart which he obviously isn't by hiring some zeros then this business would actually be thriving and happy people would return to their establishment. Epic fail to the management and staff. Please bulldoze this place down for crying out loud.
author: Heidi K.

description: Went here a while back, and can't believe I forgot to write a review! I've only been here for brunch, and I consider it a favorite. Insanely low-priced bottomless mimosas and good food. Perfect atmosphere for a Sunday Funday.
author: Bridget B.

description:
I can only rate Nickie's as a brunch spot and I am torn as to how I feel.  The menu was small (like 5 dishes), but had some interesting selections.  I opted for the stacked breakfast potatoes and my friends got the huevos rancheros.  My potatoes were yummy, but so meager.  My friends with rancheros felt similarly.  However, they did have $8 bottomless mimosas and $5 bloody mary's.  

If we had come to watch some football and drink light brunch drinks, Nickie's would have been great.  However, I was in the mood for a more filling breakfast and that just didn't occur.  That being said, our server was really friendly and attentive.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Traveling from Ohio, we stayed in the Haight-Ashbury neighborhood and visited Nickies for Sunday Brunch. The $8 bottomless mimosas are no joke - we sat at the bar and just kept getting more refills before we were even done! The eggs benedict and potatoes was tasty and very filling. Glad we were able to visit this place!
author: Angela L.

description:
wow i havent wrote a review for this place? well that sucks because this place is AWESOME!!! im super jealous i dont have a place like this around my hood. 

bottomless mimosas
decent brunch/ dinner menu
lots of tvs great for giants games
on friday night...way awesome shake your booty music!

pretty much my favorite type of bar. 

oh and watching my drunk friend falling out of a window...priceless!!!
author: Ashley H.

description:
My friend and a couple of her friends from LA LA land came into town and suggested we go here for drinks.  After catching a cab, we noticed that there was a slight line but I'm thinking the place isn't packed because its only 10pm.  Ok, I must be getting old because I don't remember people actually getting to bars until later.  

Anyway, the place was actually pretty full with some room at the bar.  I loved how there was seating on couches and corners with a dance floor in the back.  That night (Saturday) they were playing old school hip-hop, for you youngins out there that includes TuPac, Biggie, Run DMC, KRS-One and so forth.  The jams were bringing back memories from high school...love it! 

We ordered our drinks and got them pretty fast and pretty strong!  When we went to order our next round of drinks, the bartender I was ordering from told me that they don't serve hard liquor.  Wait....but I just had a double vodka and tonic so what you mean you don't serve hard liquor?!?!  Come to find out they only serve Korean Soju!!!  Yikes!  So I've been sipping on a double soju and tonic...crap I know I'm going to black out tonight!  Oh well, se la vie, can I have another then?  

The bar was awesome with great people, music and of course drinks!
author: Meuy S.

description: Visiting from the East Coast so we wee looking for a place to grab some dinner and to watch the Yankees/ Phillies.  We are so glad we decided to visit Nickies!  Lets start with the atmosphere...any sports game you want! Including the baseball package and soccer.  The sound system was sweet with tunes from the 1980's.  Nice theme for the afternoon.  Our bartender and servers were very accommodating and very, very nice.  Now the food....awesome wings, freshly made mozz. sticks, and fresh green salad, and a two cheese fresh macaroni and cheese.  Overall best place we have been to so far in SF.  Hope we can make it again before heading out!
author: Steve M.

description: Was having a really great time AT FIRST. Until we waited for about 15 minutes in between drinks for the waitress to come by(after being told we couldn't order at the bar if we were at a table), then when I nicely said that we had been waiting a very long time for our food order to be taken (20+ minutes) the waitress went over to her co workers and loudly mocked me. And I heard every word. We cancelled our food order and left. Could have been a really good time and was looking forward to some food, but sadly the attitude of the people working made that impossible.
author: Emily R.

description:
I go to Nickie's more as a restaurant than a bar and I'll say that, for bar food, it's pretty damn good.  In fact, I've never come close to having a bad meal there.  Service may be a little lacking and sluggish at best, but it's a great spot to have a casual dinner.

The mac & cheese is yummy nummers and made primarily with Gouda.  It's got kick to it too, which elevates this simple dish.  The salads are massive, very good, and most have slightly uncommon and interesting ingredients.  I'm a big fan of the fish & chips as well.

From what I've heard, they do a great brunch too, so I'm hoping I'll get down there on a weekend sometime soonish to try it out!
author: Kelly W.

description: brought ma bros to nickies. good ass chill as time yo. all the bacon you can dream of. super chill joint mofos mofos mofos. great t8ers
author: Jared H.

description:
Great neighborhood bar!  Great atmosphere, lots of TVs, a variety of alcohol and pretty tasty bar food.  

I've been here a few times, and each time I'm very satisfied with the alcohol, food and customer service.  That said though, I don't know why I don't think of coming here more often!

The place is crowded, but never too insane that I can't get a seat or a drink in a reasonable amount of time.  I've had various things on the food menu - wings, fries, breakfast burrito and veggie omlet and all is pretty tasty for being a neighborhood bar.

Another plus is the cleanliness of this place.  The women's bathroom doesn't smell like butt and there's always toilet paper, which does not go unnoticed for this bar patron.
author: Laura H.

description:
Sat at the bar close to the door, thank God because the back of the bar was soooo hot. DJ was playing reggae when we came in, switched to hip hop and then started to play radio hits... not bad but his transitions kinda sucked. The women's bathroom is clean with nicely decorated individual "rooms" each with it's own mirror. 

Our bartender, Alan, was the best!!! He made us sweet tea vodka cocktails with fresh squeezed juice and entertained us all night!
author: Sheree B.

description: Bottomless mimosas for $8 or $5 bloody mary?  Not a bad deal at all!  Came here for brunch with some friends on a Sunday. Indoor seating with old wood and a bar/pub kind of feel. Servers were nice and kept the mimosas flowing. Large portions and overall food wasn't too bad!  Maybe I was just hungry but I ate it all. I just wish they had outdoor seating too because that was such a beautiful day outside and I really hated to waste it being inside.
author: Dee H.

description: Favorite place in the lower haight. Food is great, drinks are good, service is great. The chicks that run the bar are awesome as long as you are on their good side. Be nice to them or they will be mean to you, and I don't blame them.
author: Ned H.

description:
Ok, so I've only been here once, but I had a rather enjoyable time. Of course I was self-medicated to the fullest degree possible, so my yelp reviewing powers may have been diminished.

Anyways, the coctails were ok at best, the music was alright - some decent hip-hop - so not so great in those categories

However, why not just drink straight shots or beer? They have tons of well-placed tvs for sports if you are into that sort of thing. A bunch of cool signed jerseys and enough room to dance when high n drunk.

The crowd was chill and I had a great time chatting and smoking (out front) with some irish-types.

I'd would defienitely go back.
author: Jerome, Jerome T.

description:
Why do homeless people smell sour?

Ahh lower haight, you're dirtier and more druggie infested than your upper cousin but I like you better because you don't have all those damn tourists around.

This is quite possibly the nicest place in lower haight. The bathrooms are totally clean and there are 2 bars! Lovely. 

Try the mini burgers and fries, yum!  If you're a goody-goodie then get the greens. Either way get some beers and hang out, look fun, and meet some new folks.
author: Mark B.

description: They used to be really great and they had one day of week where you could get the hamburger for five bucks and it was the best hamburger in all of San Francisco well that's all changed now now it's expensive  probably pay about 12 bucks and for Frozen patties and subpar hamburger so sad they took a good thing totally blew it.
author: Kary M.

description:
great atmosphere! The food is decent too! 

The staff are super friendly and helpful. Definitely one of my favourite sports bars now!
author: Sebastian C.

description: 'nuf said with four stars, really verging on five.  Awesome food, beer, service.  Love Nickies.
author: D.J. L.

description: One of the best casual sit down burgers in the city. I've had the fancy Nopa and Oloolo(?) burgers, but for a bar and grill kind of place, this one is top dog. Monday through friday 12-6pm it's only $5. We go almost every Tuesday for lunch there. Great Service too. Allan (think that is his name) is super sharp and witty, good banter and company while chowing down. Sara is AWESOME! Always a pleasure to see these folks. Lex the owner knows what she is doing. I'm a huge fan, and will be going back for the foreseeable future every week. I gotta try out the brunch next!
author: Devon C.

description:
So I came out to find a drink and hang with a friend, Miss Jackson.  Stumble into Nickies last night, Saturday,  and stayed until 2am.  We were not trolling but wanting to listen to good music, people watch and get the girl a 'whiskey'.

What a gem this place is! Cool interior.  Several places to sit for groups of 4 to 5 people.  Bartenders were very cool with personality and lil attitude to be genuine.

What I liked the most was the music.  Better than most dance clubs.  He read the crowd right on using every kind of genre.   We sat up on the higher level near him and just watched how everyone seem to sway or nod to the beat through out the evening. The night started out slow, not more than 10 patrons and the music kind of adapted as the crowd grew.  By midnight, people we grooving in the back in a make-shift dance floor.  At some point, a guy with a sax showed up and it was wild.  He played with every type of song, it was crazy madness.  

Food was ok (fresh jalapenos on nachos were ridiculously hot) and I probably would have given the place 3.5-4 stars if not for the DJ that I think is one of the best I've heard in a long long time.  I think he spins Thursday nights as well but not sure.

I wish I lived in the neighborhood because it definitely feels like you could check out after work for a martini but then go with friends and have a real weekend night spot.  

I told him I'd pass on the his info from his card since I will definitely get him for an event:  DLT Entertainment (415) 626-1252
www.myspace.com/TheBeatofSteel or www.thebeatofsteel.com
author: anna l.

description: Liked this place. Nice environment. Their food is really great. The jambalaya was delicious but a little on the spicy side. I'd come here to hang out
author: Alexandra H.

description:
I met my friends to watch the game last night. 

None of us had never been there before and I found this place using yelp when I was searching for Sports Bar in Hayes Valley so that we can watch the game.  

It has a dive bar / sport bar feeling with DJ, cool servers and good crowd.  Before I went there I thought it was going to be sports bar for hippies due to the location but I was wrong.  If I lived in the area, I would be hanging around there every weekend.

BTW, tall server with curly brunette was fantastic.  She was friendly and attentative.
author: M M.

description: Since I checked in here, Yelp kept bugging me to review it. The problem is that I'm not really sure what to say. There's nothing to write home about...it's simply a little sports bar in Lower Haight. It can be fun when super crowded and there are big games playing on the screens, and it can also be fun for a Sunday Funday beer. But would I choose to go here if asked? Probably not. Every time I've come in here, someone else thought it would be a good idea. It's usually totally random, and we don't stay for more than a beer or two. I personally think that there are much more fun/interesting bars in that area...but like I said, it's fun for a sports game!
author: Sonya D.

description: Had brunch there this morning-  great service, awesome food, great prices, TV's everywhere so we could watch the olympics, bottomless mimosas which were actually really good... the list goes on and on!  I ordered off the brunch menu and had the cornbeef hash-  might have been the best I've ever had!  This place is the whole package!
author: Jory S.

description:
Wow. I can't believe I've been frequenting the Haight this long and have yet to pop into Nickies! The bar has a great layout. Spacious, plenty of TVs, AMAZING service, and a solid menu to keep you going through 1am. This is a good late night spot and it doesn't get too crowded so you don't have to worry about the constant bumper car action you'd get down the street at a place like Toronados (which I do like as well). 

Anyway, the food at Nickies is clutch. I never expect much from a bar in terms of good food, but I've had a few things now (in the 3 back to back trips I"ve made). -Garden burger, boneless fried chicken, mac & cheese - all good :) Prices are good (nothing is over $13 I believe) and plenty of alcohol selection as well. 

Will have to make this my new go to bar for sure.
author: linda t.

description: Stopped by randomly mid day today, this place is really nice on the inside. I am a Jameson drinker, and when I sat down and the lady started pouring Jameson I instantly liked this place. Had a quesadilla on the go and can't wait to go back sometime for dinner. That Mac and cheese will haunt me until I try it.. Soon enough.
author: Mr. P.

description:
What a nice surprise along Haight, right at Fillmore. Just a hop, skip, and jump away from the 6,7, 71 and 22 lines. There's a long bar to sit at, tables along the wall or even the tables in the back. Brunch on weekends is nice [food's okay], but the REST of their food is just as tasty, if not better. We've tried the Mini Niman Ranch Burgers and the Mac and Cheese from the regular menu. Yum! Hooray for full kitchens. 

I've never seen Nickies at night, but I am excited to give it a shot. The weekly line-up of music played intrigues me:

Electronic Trip Hop on Tuesdays. 

Drum n Bass on Wednesdays. 

House, Disco, and Chunky Grooves on Saturdays. 

Live Irish Music on Sundays.

It all sounds fun to dance to.

Just a note - The women's restroom is in the back. The men's is at the end of the bar behind the curtain.
author: Tinna H.

description:
This place was so amazing for my birthday!

I picked this bar because it had bottomless mimosas and yummy brunch.  I had about 25 people show up but all at different times.  

I called ahead and explained the dilemma and they were more than accommodating.  They gave us the whole back area and our server was ON IT for mimosas :)

Thanks Nickies for making my bday celebration a success!!

PS: One of my roommates has some serious food allergies...the chef was also more than accommodating and she was able to enjoy yummy brunch w/ the rest of us! Thank you thank you thank you!!!!!!!!!
author: Christine M.

description:
During the World Cup and NBA finals, Nickies was one of my favorites place to go. If you get there early enough before the game you can actually get a very good spot, the ambiance was really good and they are one of the few bars that serve Carlsberg in the city. 

Major sports events watching, this is one of the chosen few.
author: Juan Camilo R.

description:
Overall: B 
I wish I was a regular here. I remember being here when it was different but I definitely like this reincarnation 

Service: B 
The cute bartender always kept my glass full. 

Value: B 
I found this place much more affordable in comparison to the many downtown bars I frequent. 

Ambiance: B 
I guess I must have been there when it was only locals because everyone seemed to know each other. Gotta love places like this!
author: Roger H.

description:
This place has the best mac 'n cheese I've had in a long, long time.

Gooey Tillamook cheddar combines with smoked gouda and baked breadcrumbs to provide an otherworldly experience. I discovered this place on New Year's Day and I've already been back at least 6 times. I've never had anything else on the menu so I can't say much about the other food items, but this bar definitely has ambiance - dark lighting, soccer on television, full bar. 

A hip bar in the lower haight without the hipsters. My kind of place.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Large portions good food great service.
author: Terrill G.

description:
Delicious smoked gouda macaroni & cheese.

Good music on Sunday night (electronic DJ with stuff like four tet, autechre, tosca, etc.)

Hoegaarden on tap. 

The volume could've been a bit lower... I love to rock out with my face pressed up against a speaker when I'm at a club, but at a bar I like to be able to have a conversation without shouting. The service was also a little slow. But I'd still come back.
author: Kimberley D.

description: Have been a couple times now. The drinks, food, and service were fantastic. We definitely over-ordered and had plenty to take home and enjoy later. It can be hard to get a place to sit and order if you go later in the evening. I'd recommend going early.
author: Miharu Y.

description:
The cleanest SF bar I've been to in years, perhaps ever, if I may be so bold.  All clean.  Bathrooms, floors, red vinyl seats, wooden benches, bar counter, paint job outside.  Clean as clean can be!  Cleaner!
Full bar, good whiskey, Magner's, Irish wait person, numerous high def monitors.  Watched the world series last night and was so impressed by the place.  An island of sparkle in the east of Fillmore lower Haight.  That's encouraging.  I haven't tried brunch yet, but that mimosa special is sending me a siren call!  
It's hella clean in Nickies!
author: Roland C.

description: bottomless mimosas for $8 during brunch!!! bff and I ordered their signature jambalaya, which was DELICIOUS, but not enough rice for me. calamari served with ranch and cocktail sauce had no flavor. if you like girls' drinks like I do, try their magner's pear. fish and chips weren't anything to talk about unfortunately and I was disappointed I couldn't try the Mac n cheese since we were on a budget through a $10 for $40 living social coupon. everything plus a blue moon totaled out around $46. good music played and super friendly service. btw alcohol are $5 straight.
author: Jessica T.

description: sports bar; one of the few bars i noticed on this street.  when you've been walking for a while, you're not as picky!  Pretty busy for a saturday early afternoon.  Got a philly cheesesteak: decent size, light on the meat, came with fries.  breakfast had just ended, but we were able to get a bowl of fruit as well.  It was a decent price, very weak drinks.  We didn't taste any alcohol.  Staff was friendly but took a while to notice us.  Wouldn't recommend it to friends
author: Sarah S.

description:
Clubbing on a week night!! 
How great is that?

It had to be Tuesday, because we wanted to hear DJ Cheb i Sabbah. His music is hard to define; lots of Indian, maybe Turkish, influences. I've learned lately that the word 'fusion" would probably save my speech at this point...

Nickies was almost empty when we arrived (well past 10 PM) but it was certainly animated when we left. They have quite a few soju based drinks but thinking of my drive home I just ordered a prosecco. Too sweet.
The music made us dance almost against our will, there was some kind of Hamelin magic in the air.  Before we realized, it was really late.

There was no time to get enough sleep. However, I have no regrets. It was a great night, and I had the greatest company. 

I'd love to come back. Even on a Tuesday :-)
author: Rosa L.

description: Nickies has good food, sports on, and decent beer prices.  They have a dj on weekends.  I'm not here very often, but when I go, I have a good time.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
This was one of the stops on my MAC & CHEESE MARATHON and thank god we did cause it was awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I just heard about it last week and already had my route but since it was so close to memphis minnie's we added it in last minute.  We ordered it togo and ate it at noc noc along with the mac and cheese from mephis minnie's and Nickies blew it out of the water!!!!! We only gave out 2 five stars and this was the other one....This was perect!!!!!! The balance of cheese to mac ratio, the texture, i mean everything was just awesome, and it was just mac and cheese!!!! I can't wait to go back here and get some more!!!!!!!! The smoked gouda was an excellent addition for cheese choice!  It made it taste like it had bacon but wit h out the bacon! NIce job!!!!  It was unanimous by all of my friends that is was 5 stars!!!!! 

Thank u!!!!!!!
author: Tara S.

description:
Nickies cleaned up well. The decor is a bit Pottery Barn-ish as someone else had commented, but I really liked how they used old doors to mount the cool wall sconces on and a steel rail from an old railroad track as the foot rest at the bar. Shea was so nice and chatted a bit with us about the facelift. 

They didn't have hard liquor, but I was able to have a soju mojito, which was refreshing and went well with the tasty bar food. I had some of the Nickies Nachos, which weren't made with any chips, but potato slices instead. While I didn't try the mini burgers and fries, I was told they were yummy, so I'll have to try them the next time I'm there.

The DJ there didn't get anyone dancing, but he provided us with some fun upbeat music. I'm not sure if the disco balls are really necessary.

If they happen to show the UCLA v. USC game on their new plasma tvs, I might just have to make it a date with Nickies this weekend. GO BRUINS!!
author: Connie C.

description:
My new favorite sports bar.

Dead on Sunday's - PERFECT if you want your own big screen TV.  Everything looks pretty spanking new:  clean floors check.  clean tables check.  clean bathroom.  CHECK.

Has a progressive but not quite committed Irish pub feel - full stock of spirits and beer.  Lots of solid draft beers.  And most importantly, lots of drink specials.  

They boast a late night menu served til 1AM.

The wings needs some work - some scrawny chicken wings up in here.  The jambalaya was pretty good - came in an iron skillet with plump whole shrimp and andouille sausage.  The mac and cheese was pretty bomb - had the nice creamy texture and that au gratin baked cheese crisp on top.  Legit.  

Super private, new, and a real cool wait staff.  What more do you need?
author: Isaac L.

description: First time my wife and I went there for lunch and a beer we sat at a table for 20 mins. the server kept walking past us not even acknowledging that we were there. Granted they were busy but at least say I'll be with you in a few mins. We couldn't get up to the bar to order a drink, to many people. We finally got up and left. Wasted 1/2 hr. Decided to try it again a month later (9-26) around 2:30 pm.I was by myself this time for lunch and a beer. The place was not busy I counted 4 tables occupied. Sat there for 10 mins. same waitress as first visit working. She wouldn't even make eye contact. Went to bar and got a bloody mary, which was pretty good, sat back down at my table. Same story waitress totally ignoring me. Finished my drink still no waitress. Went back to bartender ordered a beer.A party of 4 sat next to me. took waitress 10 mins. to get to them.  They got their drinks and food. Finished my beer still now waitress. She was standing at the bar talking. Seemed like she had no interest in taking care of customers. Wanted to try food but...... I was in F&B for over 35 years. This waitress needs a wake-up call. The star is for the friendly bartender.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Let's talk about under-rated bars, shall we?

I'm not sure what's not to like...

The Dj was good, definitely dance-able music, nice Irish bartendar, modern/chic decor, good neighborhood, ample seating:bar, tables and even boothes (!), great beer selection....do I realy need to go on? On a Fri night it was pretty empty, to our great surprise.  My friends and I thought this place was very decent and were wondering why no one stopped in, except a few ppl who seem to come there often. This is where I come in....all I can do it Yelp about it, but seriously people...it's a nice place...

Minor drawback: no hard liquor, they have smth pronounced "so jus" which I think is a substitute for vodka....not sure...vodka redbull was on the menu, as well as cosmos, so I could be wrong. Whatever the case, it's a hot spot for beer, wine and bubbley.

Also, there is a count-down clock for St. Paddy's day....something tells me this place might be happening when it comes around.
author: Aristocles P.

description:
Well I for one will certainly never be going back to the new, "improved" spiffed up and yes, soul-less, "new" Nickies.
Sure- the old one was a total pit, but you weren't going to be given a bum's rush for walking in and taking an hour to decide what (if) you wanted to drink. No more Dead nights either- I suppose they figure they lost the most money cause Dead Heads aren't drunks! And who'd want to sit still for the new bougie, high priced menu.
Can't say I don't wish they'd actually made some improvements on the place when it was still a freak hole, but the new Nickies is Nickies lite, and the old one has gone the way of all great local institutions, undone by yuppies, greed and Manhattanization. 
A real snooze. Hang on to your cash and visit the Mad Dog.
author: Mark L.

description:
solid. They have some of the coldest beers on tap in the city, which I dig. Also a good brunch menu as well as a respectable dinner menu. But the thing that KILLS it is the new deal they have-- $7 bottomless mimosas 10-2pm on saturdays and sundays w/ purchase of brunch item. 

Walked in for a mellow brunch on sunday before going outside lands, not knowing about this deal. After my boyfriend asks "wait, she can really drink ALL she wants??" and bartender responded with "well...I doubt she could drink that many without falling off her chair..." I had to retaliate. So, at 3 o'clock we stumbled in to OL for less than the price of one puny brewsky.

stoked. But lets not crowd up the bar now.
author: Afton T.

description:
Nickies...the perfect apres-Robotspeak joint.  I kid, of course.

Their website sort of plays up the dance-lounge aspect, but at 7 PM the DJ booth lies mercifully vacant, and it's a great place to grab a beer and even dinner (from a very limited menu).  Unexpectedly polished for the Lower Haight (love the candle-lattices on the walls--I need one of those for my place), but hey, they serve Cajun food while hosting live Irish music, and there were like 3 toddlers in here for some reason.  So basically a textbook study in SF eclecticism.  Especially with the sweet smell of weed smoke wafting in from the MCD across the street.

Anyway, throw in the friendly bartender and delicious catfish po' boys, and you've got a nice alternative to the traditional Toronado/Rosamunde's or Indian dive options next time you're in Lower Haight.
author: Wes M.

description: Two words: Bottom Mimosas. Please don't go because I don't want any issues trying to get a table for brunch! Anyway, if you do you will find that the food is good, the service is friends and the mimosas keep on coming. What more could you want in a bar/ bottomless mimosa brunch? Answer: nothing.
author: Shanna T.

description: Will not be going back! My sister and I went here for lunch. We had the fried chicken salad and chilli. The fried chicken was flavorless and the chilli looked like dog food and tasted real bad. We both had stomach issues afterwards and we did not even eat much.
author: Adriana B.

description: This place is pretty cool. Very chill bar, good atmosphere and I like how the crowed is diverse and so is the music. Good size bar, TV screens, beer and drinks of all kinds, and pretty friendly.  I haven't eaten here yet but I will definately come back.
author: X X.

description:
Okay, so my friend and I went to Nickie's a couple of Fridays ago for their "friends and family" night.  It was supposed to be for the owner's friends and family.  My boyfriend and I know one of the bartenders there, and my boyfriend was even hired for the night to check IDs, etc.  So my friend Krista and I "qualified" as friends and family...but  not for long.

We step in, and the place is pretty sweet!  It had been closed for awhile and the new owner has obviously put some money into the place. They weren't serving hard liquor that night, but but they were serving beer, wine and champagne. For free.  

So everything is going fine, we were introduced to the owner, and he seemed like a really nice guy, we thanked him for having us over, etc., especially since the bar was not officially open to the public yet.  So far, so good.

I guess we got a little rowdier than we intended or expected to.  From what my boyfriend told me, Krista's boyfriend came by with one of his friends, who later proceeded to hit on the owner's wife.  Great.  My boyfriend also told me we were being loud and making a ruckus, too.  I don't  remember that part, but I also don't remember getting 86'd, wandering off, or buying a burrito either.  (I really wish I remembered where I got the burrito - it was GOOD!).  Either way, drunk or not, I hold myself accountable for, well, myself.

So...Krista, her boyfriend, his friend and I are banned from Nickie's for life (For life? FOR LIFE!), and this is before the place was even officially reopened.  This saddens me 'cause I really am a nice gal, and *I* certainly  wasn't the one hitting on the owner's wife.  (Though I admittedly feel a little bad-ass, or maybe I just feel like an ass.  Eh, it's a little bit of both).

If the owner reads this, I do apologize for me and my friends' behavior that night. Please don't take think any less of Tadgh or Jacob as a result.

Respectfully Yours, 
Ghetto S.
author: Karen F.

description:
I'm confused.  If a whole park full of people gets kicked out of Alamo Square for shooting off fireworks at midinght on the Fourth of July, left to prowl the nearby streets for more booze and social intercourse, why is this most convenient option a ghost town?  Nickies is the type of place that wants so badly to be crowded and hopping (I gather this from the decor and DJ), maybe it's like a desparate woman throwing itself at the city?  One has to wonder if on most occasions those are the types to walk through the door.  I don't know, Nickie's, I don't know.

Good tap/wine/cocktail selection.  DJ was not so impressive with the tiresome Marley routine.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Upscale Irish bar? Excellent pub food?? Sit down restaurant?! This place was once the funnest, sweatiest place for reggae & 70s funk dance music...a great Saturday was once Thep Pahom, Toronado's, (nextdoor sausage snack) then late-night bumping at Nickie's BBQ. There were no barstools - let alone tables! Oh well, 5 stars for nostalgia...
author: Nina S.

description:
The first time I came here, it was on a first date with my current boyfriend and we had a great time...even if it was just us two there.  The place was empty on a Friday night, which was a little strange since the music was FUN (albeit a bit loud), the drinks were good, and the place was newly remodeled so not old and stank like many other places on Haight St.  I initially thought that the lack of patrons had to do with the bar's limited liquor license, but then I came back a few months later to try their cajun cuisine.  

It was 8:50pm on a Wednesday night, my friend and i browsed the menu for 10 minutes and finally decided on some dinner items.  Even though  the dinner menus clearly said "KITCHEN CLOSES AT 10PM",   we were told in a completely unapologetic way by the bartender, that the kitchen had already closed for the night.  

So annoying.  

Note to Nickies management:  If you're going to close the kitchen early, take the menus off the tables people.  Don't let us spend time getting excited about jambalaya and po-boys only to find out none of it's available.  Jeez!  Definitely not a way to build business and attract repeat customers.
author: LaSha G.

description: Good place. It's nice enough decor, atmosphere, and exterior to seem out of place in this neighborhood. Lots of screens, and not too crowded or noisy, even on a Friday night. Randi, our server, was very attentive and Lexi (the manager) was great about helping ensure our group had space. Burger and fries was excellent for $5 (12-6pm) though not sure it's worth the regular  $12 price. Still, it's as good as $12 burgers elsewhere. They have an impressive array of food for $5 all day Fridays, so if you're in the neighborhood, this is a good choice.
author: Bill B.

description:
Yay for Nickies!  Yes, I'm a fan.  My boyfriend, a friend of ours and I headed over to Nickies for their election party.  The minute we stroll in Obama supporters are cheering and toasting the great victory.  We were just minutes too late to see the precise moment when Obama received the over 270 electoral votes, but we didn't care....we were witnessing history in the making.  We quickly ordered a beer, toasted to Obama and soaked in the scene and crowd.

Nickies epitomizes what one would expect of a Pac Heights/Haight Bar--not quite Marina or grunge hip either.  I like the sports bar turned wine and beer bar vibe.  Dark wood, chill vibe with lots of flat screens all around.  Second bar near the women's restroom is nice too.  The people seem friendly enough, but wonder if it's because I was surrounded by like-minded folk the night the first African American president was elected president.  (Could have something to do with it.)  In any case, the bartenders did a good job attending to the anxious folks at the bar, and there was plenty of room to sit and stand around and near the bar.

I didn't have any of the food that night, but it sure did look and smell appetizing.  The sliders were calling out my name, but alas, I ate a big lunch and dinner and couldn't have possibly given it the fair shake it deserved.  Next time, Nickies, next time...

I will be returning to Nickies as they have all my favorite beers on tap, and for the nights I feel more like wine or champagne, their selection for those is great too.  I won't lie, I do like the occasional vodka tonic or SoCo Lime shot in a dive bar or posh lounge, but for a more mellow night, Nickies has the right combination.
author: Marie B.

description: This was the first bar I have been to in San Francisco that not only had the alcohol I prefer to drink, but did not try to swindle me by having a cheaper alcohol in the bottle I requested. I have been in the bar industry for three years now and have grown up drinking scotch. I know how it tastes and I know my brands. It was very refreshing to order a Balvenie on the rocks and actually have Balvenie in my glass. The bartenders were very friendly and the service was perfect. It was the first time I have been out in SF without being bombarded with EDM music, terrible service, and cheap alcohol. Thanks Nickies! I will definitely be coming back next time I am in town!
author: Bekah R.

description:
I really like the atmosphere here, very chill and loungey. Good selection of beer and wine. The music at the time wasn't the best I've ever heard, but I'm sure things will pick up...

Update: The music was great on one Friday night. They traded off DJs, each with their own sound which made for a nice experience...
author: Nicolas H.

description: The mac and cheese here is bomb.  It's made in house, and baked in the same dish it is served.  Bottomless mimosas for weekend brunch, and hoeegarden on tap keep me coming back:)
author: Torrey R.

description: Can't speak for the food - but as a bar it's decent. There are actually a surprising amount of areas for groups (if you can snipe 'em).... few large booths, large tables, smaller tables you can pull together.  Not a bad place to go with a group of people (not all bars are). Beers range $5-$7 (standard) and the service was pretty good.  Lots of TVs too for games.  If you're a Cal fan - $1 off drinks on game days....
author: Elizabeth B.

description: I went here on Friday to watch my Rox take on the Dodgers.  I was able to procure a tv for myself with my game at the bar even during a busy evening with a Cal game on.  Totally rad if you ask me.  The chicken strips were just fine and the Smithwick's was cold and tasty.  Dudes behind the bar were totally cool and the other patrons didn't give me any shit for watching my game.  I like it.  Also, my name's Nick just like the place so that's rad too.  Nice.
author: Nicholas N.

description: Outstanding. Used to come here when it was a Punk bar and it was awesome then. We were making a late get outta the house, and my friend said... i want to go to the Haight and i want bottomless mimosas. Kinda made me worried, but... i looked at Yelp while we were coming down Franklin saw about 7 places. She was edging toward mission while i said, lets go right on Haight. As we pulled past Webster, there was a spot right in front. It was meant to be. We hoped in, waited about 5 mins for some bar space to open, and ordered the mimosas which are $8 unlimited when you buy brunch. I had the has and she had the beni. Both were good. Not overly flavorful, but very fresh. Mimosas were a pretty much on the juice side. We were all complaining at the bar about how we were puckering and over full from the juice. So ask for a thinner of champagne. Great service. I'm sure they'll accomodate whatever you need.
author: Adam X.

description:
WOO! so as a new lower haighter...i was over-joyed with excitement to find that three blocks away is a Full sports Bar/DJ & live music/delicious food joint. I went to Nickies on a sunday afternoon to watch some football with friends. I was starving and ordered the Chipotle chicken sandwich with bacon and a side of mixed greens. it was REALLY GOOD. not your average bar food...my sister and friends ordered the steak sandwich, veggie burger, apple blue cheese cole slaw, wings, and fries...as a standard taste tester for all...everything met my high expectations...the wings however could have been bigger with better sauce, but everything else was great.

They played almost all the football games on different screens, so take your pic!...beer selection was good...they had two of my favs, which are sometimes rare to be on tap: Hoegarden and Smithwicks, of which I had about 6 pints of :)

Wait Service was the only thing that was slow, but it was sunday funday and the bar was pretty packed with football Nazis. If this is a problem, you can always walk up to the bar and order from the bartender.

Also, apparently they have DJ's certain nights during the week (def on friday) and live Irish bands play Sunday nights...i love it!

As this is one of the only bars which serves liquor on Haight...thank you Nickies for being there for me! :)
author: Katie D.

description:
If you're looking for a bar to unwind after a grueling day at work, Nickie's is the place to be.  
This clean and relaxing bar calms your every nerves with the help of the friendly bartender whom ofcourse I cant remember her name.  
Drinks are reasonably priced and dosage are up to par.  
Bathrooms are well kept.  Very important for I will be taking numerous trips after consuming lots of beers and ctails.  
There are TVs for the games and also a DJ on some nights.  
This place never gets too crowded which is good if you need a night of good convo and buzz.
author: Rovie T.

description:
Yet another bar found guilty of the crime of Wrongful and Inappropriate use of a Disco Ball.
Other than this far too common misdeed, Nickie's is alright.  
The neon sign draws you in like a mosquito to a zapper on some toothless bastards back patio, which is actually a great analogy for its location in Lower Haight as well.
Unfortunately, thats about as exciting as it gets.
However... 
Never(ever) underestimate the simple joy and wonder a neon bug zapper can bring.  

There is beer, thats cool.  Nothing that will blow your mind, but good ones.
There is some wine and champagne, but no hard liquor...semi disappointing.
The actual wood on the bar is quite nice, I would definitely spoon it if I could.  
The Reggae/Dancehall night was cool and definitely helped provide some good energy.

A little something for everyone at Nickie's...people-watch from the seats against the wall, dance in front of the raised DJ booth or get grope-y at the bar.
Gotta say, not bad Nickie's, not bad.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Cheb i Sabbah is like a cross between Serge Gainsbourg and Bill Burroughs.  

Great goddamn music.
author: Brian M.

description:
This place is a surprise hit. From the outside I wasn't expecting much. When I walked in I was pleased with the clean and cute interior. The bar was packed, with a very relaxed atmosphere. Just a bar full of people enjoying themselves, not attitudes or pretenses. 

The drinks were OK, could have been a little stronger, but what are you going to do? The DJ is what really made the night. He was playing the jams that really got the party started, especially my guiltiest pleasure, "Damaged," by Danity Kane. (hahaha, DON'T JUDGE). Even though most people in the bar do not dance, who cares about them. Come here with a group of friends, get drunk and be somebody.
author: Bobby P.

description:
So I finished yoga last night and walked down Haight to get something to eat with my friend. We stop at Love n Haight but don't have enough cash. We continue walking until we reach Haight and Fillmore and see this large neon "N" sign in green blaring at us. We both looked at each other and said, almost eerily twinnish and in unison "What the hell is that 'N' about?!"

We cross and decide to investigate.

As we approach we hear promisingly good hip hop music coming through the doorway and in we walk. Low dim lighting, wooden detail, a few flat screen tv's, nice plush seating areas, and a gorgeous bar are what we see inside. It was their first night last night open to the public.

We decide to get a slice of pizza at Volare next door before having a night cap cocktail. Ain't nothin like a cocktail after yoga. or a slice of cheesy pizza. ahahahaha...

I digress...

The re-incarnation of Nickie's is pretty remarkable. It looks amazing. And its the cutest damn bar in my neighborhood so now its my new neighborhood watering hole. The kitchen had already closed when we got there so I can't wait to actually try some of their food menu. 

You should check it out. It's cute.

The only reason I'm dockin' em one star at the moment is because the beats were on repeat and we heard the same songs over and over. And we were only there for an hour. I'll be interested to hear what kind of DJ talent they bring in.
author: Matthew M.

description: C'mon guys! When it's hot and your customers are miserable, have a plan! I would have given this place a 5 if there was AC! Bartenders and drinks are awesome BTW
author: D R.

description:
I pass by this place almost every day on my way to work.  After reading the great reviews, I decided to stop in on a Friday after work.  Drinks here are pretty reasonably priced and the atmosphere is nice and chill, perfect for a Friday.  We had the fried calamari and mac & cheese to start.  I liked the fried calamari, though for the price I think Bean Bag is better.  The mac & cheese was good to me, but it tasted a lot better when I added hot sauce.  We split a fish & chips and the "jambalaya".  The jambalaya is more like gumbo, not that that's a bad thing, but you should know what you're ordering.  I'd definitely order the "jambalaya" again especially on a cold day in SF, it really hit the spot.  I'd skip the fish and chips just because they really absorb a lot of grease in the deep fryer more so than I've had at other places.  It's a great neighborhood place and I'll be back.

For cocktails we had a mango mojito and a bloody mary.  The bloody mary was super salty, and we had to ask them to take it back.  The waitress was super nice about it though and didn't charge us for it.  I always feel horrible sending things back, but she didn't make me feel bad at all.
author: Joann C.

description:
I've experienced bad service here before, but today was simply awful.

When we first walked in I noticed there was no bartender behind the bar, instead she was busy putting money into the juke box and was completely unaware of people coming in and ordering drinks.

 I sat down at the bar next to another girl who was chatting with a friend. After waiting about 5 minutes for a drink the girl next to me got up and went behind the bar and asked me what I wanted to drink, I had no idea she was a bartender because she was sitting next to me talking with a friend for so long. 

After a few beers I went to close my tab only to see my bill at $71 for four Stellas and a plate of nachos. After a few minutes of argument they changed my bill to around $30 which made sense. 

My sister ordered a Bloody Mary for herself and a Diet Coke for me, she had to order twice and they still didn't brink our drinks.
