There was one girl with curly hair who looked kinda new and like she wanted to help us, but the other bar tenders stepped in and took over for her and completely ignored us.

I am highly disappointed with the service here especially since I have lived in the neighborhood for several years and the service never gets any better.
author: Spryte H.

description:
Nickie's has been remodeled and is now a beer and wine bar with food. A group of us went here today and it was their first day opening since the remodel. The space reminds me a lot of Rye in that minimalist clean but natural look. They have a back bar that is sort of private next to the kitchen and feature a DJ in the evening. 

We ordered the fish and chips and the mini burgers both well prepared and tasty.  Overall it was a nice afternoon and a wonderful experience. I will be going back soon...(Dunzo let's do lunch and talk bag business).
author: Teddy d.

description: Cute place! Yummy bar food! very spacious too :)
author: Courtney C.

description:
This is the best sports bar in the city. Always clean and the service is great. It has a local lower haight feel and good beers. Although they should get the poppy Jasper on tap soon if they really wanna blow us away. Good eats, though those good eats are overpriced.  Their burger is decent and chicken Sammy is bomb- excellent fries. 

Don't order the wings or the fish and chips - nasty and had weird gray all over them. 

Flat screens all over- great surround sound for the football games,  also it gets good light in the front and can go pretty dark if you're in the back. Feels cozy and like your neighborhood awesome bar.
author: Megan M.

description: If you want really loud overly played pop music this is your place on a Saturday night!
author: Y S.

description:
Nickie's is like one of those kinda popular girls you used to know in high school.

She was popular because she was hot but then she started getting dilapidated and nasty from the parties, extracirricular stuff and dating all the popular dudes.  By senior year she had gained some weight, wasn't looking so good and you didn't mind parting ways.

Fast forward 5 years later after college and you pass by her in a mall and you're like "wow!".  She's fit, well-dressed and smiling.

Such is Nickie's, upgrading from the divey place it used to be to this chic "sort of" dance club and I say "sort of" because it hasn't been really packed or had much dancing the two nights I've been there.  Yeah it appears they might've lost their liquor license (only beer and wine served) but I find the space and lighting to be enjoyable.  There's plenty of room to get around so hopefully you won't suffer too much elbowing when it gets more crowded.  Also props on having a bar in the back to save everyone from slogging through the crowd to get another drink.  Given this, the set-up can be a little weird.  It's like "bar" and "club" kind of co-existing in one big room.  

They have some pretty good beers on tap including the Speakeasy brews, Chimay, Trumer Pils and Leffe.  I do strongly dislike that they don't have a liquor license, this place has the perfect decor and mood for martinis and cocktails, not to mention 3 beers greases the wheels for a shot of Jagermeister.  Overall this place is a 3.5, I'm still searching for the half star to make this place the legit 4 I want it to be.

Hey DJ, turn the music down, it's Wednesday night and there's like 15 people here total, none of which look remotely close to getting up and dancing.
author: Steven R.

description:
Pretty cool spot.  I like to come here for the food.  I love the fact that when i am drinking, i can order some food.  And its not just regular bar food, its actually real food.  

And the service is pretty on top of things.  The bar is pretty clean and has a sort of lounge like feel to it.  And they even have DJ's on certain nights.  I have yet to be here when it was crazy packed, so thats good.  Less waiting time for me to drink.
author: Terence P.

description:
Smooth with a touch of swank without being pretentious.  

The interior is done in a very low key lounge atmosphere.  There are numerous tables and chairs so this bar is excellent for smaller groups as everyone will be comfortable and able to be in the group.  The floor plan is well laid out and offers easy opportunities for groups to mingle with others.

The beer selection is superb as well as the pub food offerings.  The smallish menu offers a step above normal pub fare and will do more than just fill you up.  Honestly, its nice to run into a bar that offers this option.  Sometimes I want to grub and not have to find somewhere else to go or order freakin fried cheese or something equally unappealing.

The DJ spins a nice mellow mix and this is also a really nice plus.  What you'll hear is the live equivalent to XM Chill with some upbeat R&B and some well mixed hip hop interjected.  The volume is just right as well.

The bathrooms will rival Danny Coyle's for the nicest in the Lower Haight.  In fact ... they're nicer.

The staff is quite friendly as well.

Now, when you pop in it will seem slow.  Hopefully NIckie's will catch on and reward the owners for such a great effort.  I'll be back again and again so they get my support.  Sometimes it takes some sacrifice as a customer to help a business through the leaner times.  That said...it is quite refreshing to me too that it is not crazy busy.  I feel like I am how Dane Cook described his reactions to going to clubs as you get older..., "its kinda to fucking loud."  So..I am seeking out a little mellower haunts and this is right up that alley.
author: Chris D.

description:
Great sliders and the fried chicken was... wonderful!  The chicken came with fluffy and amazing mashed potatoes!

The atmosphere is chill and really great ambiance.  The food was definitely comfort food and they even had grilled polentas that looked reeeeally delicious.  They were playing old school 80's music from Cutting Crew, Def Leppard, Eric Carmen and Van Halen.  With football season starting, I might just have to venture here for a beer and Sunday night game day!
author: Christina C.

description:
This is a nice looking bar, the drink specials are all right, the service is average, but the food is pretty poor.

Go here to drink.
author: Dixon T.

description:
You know I kinda tend to forget about this place when trying to think of places to grab a drink. Once I am out I have the "ohhh yeahhhh" reaction and sometimes that is enough to get me inside.

Great place to grab a beer. Lots of seating and it's actually quite comfortable. I can't say much about the music but I've never been to one of their event nights either.

I do wish that they would pick one sorta genre and stick to it. Are you a sports bar? An Irish bar? A brunch joint? (I really don't recommend the brunch). I tend to like places that pick a theme and go for it. I have a hard enough time trying to pick out one place to go, a place that is different every time is doing me no favors.
author: Allegra F.

description: music? cool. decor? cool. space? cool. bathrooms? super cool. pizza place next door? awesome.
author: Ann T.

description:
Really cool place to hang out and have a cool beer with friends. They have a good selection of beer and wine. Food is good if you're hungry, mini burgers are great and the fish and chips are tasty. 

The decor is comfortable and it does have the natural look. I love the rail track foot rail, and gas pump door handle. I

If you're in the area, you should check this place out.
author: Raymond H.

description:
Had dinner here on a Thursday night.  Really cool, modern and simple decor..fun Southern menu...great beverage selection...and awesome 50's/60's dinner music!  I like the fact that they had sports on tv, but "Tracks of my Tears" pumping through the speakers. 
Food-wise they offer mac and cheese, jambalaya, fried chicken, chipotle chicken sandwich, etc.  The jambalaya was the best at our table.  And any bar that serves a Hefeweizen, Bud Light AND PBR is A-OK in my book.
author: Adrea F.

description: Ok atmosphere. Ordered a chicken salad and got a warm spinach with loads of bacon that tasted like a salt lick. Not one to return items so I took a few bites and went home hungry. I know, it's bar food and I wasn't expecting anything more, but seriously, even my date choke on it and bacon is his favorite food group. Atmosphere is ok, not anything exciting. I went on a weekday evening so maybe that was the issue. I'd still go back for a beer if enouraged.
author: Soren A.

description:
Major probs for being the only bar in the Lower Haight iwth no creidt card minimum.

Food here is all right, nothing special. I went here for brunch and to watch football, and it was enjoyable. Very nice interior; friendly service.
author: Mark A.

description:
Love this place! The atmosphere is a perfect balance between not-too-fussy and really nicely done up, which means the crowd is really cool without being snobby. The decor is minimalist yet chic, and the ambience lets you pretend you're a rock star (both times I've been there, people have broken out in dance cuz the DJs are great!). This is a really easy place to spend all night without a huge fuss yet still have a great time. 

Oh - and the food, drink, and service are all fantastic.

Definitely worth a visit or ten...
author: Mama D.

description:
Forgive me if this review is a bit slurred, but I just spent 8 bucks at Nickies for 6 PBRs.  They're only a dollar, but I tipped them.  Keep in mind those prices are only from 4-6 PM, but here's what I loved about Nickie's today: I went in at 5:55 expecting only to purchase a beer or two but the bartender asked me if I wanted to buy more since the price was going up, then she kept them in the fridge for me (yes, PBR in the bottle the finest of the fine).

The place has food, from mini-burgers to salad to fish tacos, and apparently it has hard alcohol which I used to believe it didn't.  While it was more for cocktails, that combined with the cheap PBR gives Nickies an extra two stars.

The interior is classy, and I believe it does sort of have a coat check, or at least there are hooks to put your coat on underneath the bar.  There are tons of TV's and if there's a sporting event that is the focus of the bar for that night they put the TV on.  On Wednesdays there's a jazz band.  

Some may say that Nickie's lacks an identity, but there are other places to go if whatever's going on there is not your cup of tea.  Nickie's tries to keep you entertained, fed and drunk.  If you don't  like it, maybe you weren't there at the right time.  The fact is sometimes I wouldn't be caught dead in the place, but other times there is nothing better.  And there's nothing wrong with that, if you ask me.
author: Alex M.

description: I just had my birthday party here last week and it was fantastic.  Lexie reserved the whole back area for us and was so accommodating. The DJ was great  and played all the music we requested and our server was very friendly and attentive as was the bartender.  This used to be the old Nickies BBQ dance club (which I loved) but now has a cleaned up, sports vibe.  Still a great place to dance and have a party though!
author: Elizabeth F.

description:
On the whole, I'm down with Nickie's 2.0

Decor is good, HDTVs are good, food is good. Mac N Cheese is dope!

BUT (and this is a big one) I can't go in when they do anything except serve food/drink and keep it quiet. The do a DJ/Dance thing, but they don't do it well. And I don't really feel Irish folk music, sorry. 

When there's nothing going on inside, Nickie's gets 5 stars.
author: Josh K.

description: LOVE this bar. drinks are good, service is good, but food is amazing! everything taste really fresh and homemade... which is not usual for bar food. The potato skin appetizers are really good. But really this review is all about the brunch menu! so yummy! the best corn beef hash ever! definitely try it out for brunch!
author: Kat C.

description: I thought this was a very good place to meet friends for a chat and a drink. The service was very good and I had a bay shrimp salad that I quite liked as well. The bathrooms were IMMACULATE. This is a BAR with CLEAN bathrooms!! Amazing.
author: Jessica O.

description:
I think I went to the old Nickies once when she was a totally different person. So I have some vague memories of her and the packed dance floor I stood on.  

The new Nickies comes across as a pretty swanky bar (at least for Lower Haight) that serves really delicious bar food. I love eating here. The mini-burgers are amazing, the fried seafood basket in superb and beats a typical fish n chips basket any day, the Cajun chicken sandwich is perfectly spicy. 

The bartender/owner guy is equally awesome, he's quick and friendly and very pleasant. The drinks are also good, the cucumber martini is really yummy although when I go here I typically have beer. I usually go during week days when it's not super crowded, but it seems like they're getting slowly popular which is good for them. I hope they stick around.
author: Allister F.

description:
Love, Love, LOVE my neighborhood bar!! Great beers on tap such as Stella, Big Daddy, Trumer Pils, Leffe, Hemp Ale, Smithwicks Ale, Sierra, and probably 10 others I forgot to mention. The service is great with Lexi running and managing the place. They have happy hour with 2 dollar pints and I think they even have 1 dollar Pabst during happy hour as well. Tons of European soccer and rugby on. Thursday late night we get awesome tunes from DJ Paz who brings old school hip hop, new school rap, a little house, and tons of oldies but goodies. 

Rumor has it there are few weeks away from putting some great bourbon and scotch's up on their shelves. That's right. I think they will be receiving their liquor license in a few weeks. So get there now so they can remember your face for that special free birthday shot you so desire on your special day, when you get messy and no one cares because it's your birthday!

And I totally forgot to mention how great their fries are! Yummy goodness that pairs so well with your pint of ice cold beer!
author: monika l.

description:
The atmosphere is really nice. I like the dim lights and the music - looks abnormally classy for its location. 

However, the utter stupidity of our service and the mediocre food experience caused me to drop the stars.

They have a great selection of beers so if you're in the area and you want a nice lounge to enjoy your beer and talk to your friends (we were the only ones there at 7pm on a Wed.) then its great.

Not a dinner destination ...maybe not even a light fare with drinks destination.
author: Inna H.

description: Alight bar, alright food, cool ambiance, nothing remarkable.
author: Michael E.

description:
I came here on a Monday night and was pleasantly surprised.  I had read the reviews but really, how are you ever to believe that a sports bar would have clean bathrooms!!  They were immaculate.  Not that this is a reason to go, but wow.  I'm still impressed.  
Other reasons this place deserves my four stars:
-they serve food..good food
-really nice bartender
-great ambiance 
-take credit cards which is something you appreciate when you hail from the mission bar scene
-Monday night game where its possible to win $ (I didn't, but oh well)
I want to see what this place is like on the weekends before I go for the fifth star.  I will be back!
author: Katie S.

description: Nice little place. Casual and hip, good drinks and within walking distance of plenty of other dive bars and drinking establishments :)
author: Sam C.

description:
Nickies is a fine little Irish pub, or at least as Irish as you are going to find in the States.  Sunday night come by for a session and a pint of good black Guinness.  I anxiously await the day when I can order liquor, but I am told the day will come.

Prices are much better than nearby Irish pubs and the service ultra-friendly.  They have good pub food with flair, but I would steer clear of the deep fried stuff- a bit on the salty side.
author: Cheezy P.

description:
I had never boozed in the Lower Haight before the other night.

I would describe it as... eh... um... ecclectic. It's a different scene down there. I don't think I've ever seen dope smoked so freely on the streets before. There was s dude smoking a doobie by the door, and as we were leaving, some dudes were smoking a blunt on the sidewalk across the street.... totally casually.

Dope may not be my scene, but I suppose I'd return to this place. It's got kind of an Irish Hipster Fusion thing going on in there. On a Saturday night it wasn't really packed, but it was a comfortable bar. In the back up a couple stairs are a lounge alcove behind a DJ booth and another little alcove with a table and it's own HD TV. It was great, we had Sports Center on a loop for like 3 hours!

They had a great beer selection... meaning they had bottles of PBR, which I took full advantage of. They were on the pricey side (like $3.50/$4 apiece), but I'm glad they had it anyway.

The DJ action was strange... they were playing some sort of weird house/heroin industrial music, which I didn't take a shining to, but the group of weirdos in the alcove behind it were down. One dude had a bald head and dangling earrings... anywaaaaaay....

It wasn't a bad little joint. Not totally my scene (Haight in general), but I'd go back sometime.
author: Dan P.

description:
I come here on Sundays to watch football.

They have a ton of TV's and you can always find a seat around your game.  It gets a little hectic at 1pm when they are changing over the games and people are asking for their checks.

The wait staff is a little short handed but very nice and if they feel you've been neglected they will make it up with a few free pint's.  The crowd is good never any problems with stupid disrespectful fans.

The manager is a great guy, not sure if that is Nickie or what but he was very accommodating when I wanted my game put on a back TV all by my self. 

The food has been pretty good for bar food.  The wings leave a little left to be desired but the huevos rancheros  and steak sandwich are pretty good.  I stopped going to Danny Croyles and this is my new spot.   Better place for football plus food = happier sundays.
author: Jackson D.

description: My favorite place to brunch in SF. $8 bottomless mimosas when you order food. It gets super busy during football season, get there right at 10 a.m. if you want a table for the first set of games. Usually clears out between a.m. and afternoon games so you can get a table pretty easily around 1 p.m. (depending of course on when local teams are playing). Staff is super nice. I've tried almost every dish on the brunch menu and they're all delish. Breakfast burrito is huge. Love the Nickies Scramble.
author: Stephannie D.

description: The food at Nickies is pretty fantastic.  I love the feel of the place and the bartenders are always on point.  Great service, great beer on draft overall very nice place to be even if you arent a sports fan.
author: Adam P.

description:
I am head over heels in love with this place! 

It is clean, not crowded, has $1 PBR happy hour, serves organic/sustainable meats for dinner, and it is a block from my house!!! Are you freakin' kidding me? All this time I've been trekking down to castro or danny coyle's to find a decent place to hang out (where I won't feel horribly out of place) and this den of heaven was right here!

I've been twice now - once for $1 PBR happy hour (what's not to like) and a second time for brunch, which was delicious! Rather than being a sucker and waiting in line for Kate's we just wandered over to Nickies and stuffed our faces with eggs, bacon, jambalaya, and mac and cheese. Everything was seasoned and cooked perfectly!

Update: we had dinner here last night - sliders and fried chicken. The fried chicken had too much cinnamon for me, but the burgers, fries, and mashed potatoes were perfection on a plate.

I love the randomness of the place and the fact that it's not too crowded. Just go.
author: Corinne R.

description: came in last saturday to use a expiring living social $40 coupon. the 28 year old female bartender was just effin' awesome.  i will be back. and they have samsung HDTVs.
author: Pickle R.

description: Great venue for Denver Broncos fans!    Had a blast with a bunch of Manning devotees and the beer was cold and food was hot.  Super easy to get to.   Fun place.
author: Tonya D.

description:
Nickies is my celebration spot - I went here for NYE and to see the election results. :)

The drinks are good and stiff. The service is nice and prompt. The food is tasty - but small - not so "American" as a lot of other restaurants. I wouldn't assume you'll have leftovers.

The DJs can be a bit much,  but they are perfectly suited to the hip atmosphere. Just don't sit too close to the speakers...
author: Kathleen D.

description: Grilled fish the best with butter mashed potatoes and veggies too good to be true.
author: Hermandrea T.

description: It's a good place to hangout and grab a beer or catch a game. Food is pub food. nothing special or memorable. But the place gets crazy and packed on trivia nights and the weekend.
author: Minh V.

description: Thumbs up for the mood of this clean clean Britishy-Irishy style pub, but thumbs down for the cracked out waitresses.
author: eric w.

description:
Once upon a time, back when San Francisco was the best city in the world, Nickie's Barbeque was a funky old bar, not much bigger than a hallway,  where you could go and get impossibly close with a few dozen of your new best friends and dance to obscure funk music while drinking Brazilian beer.

I don't know what this place is supposed to be, but it sure shouldn't be called Nickie's
author: Chris E.

description:
Along with rnm, this is one of the oases in the dark chasm of the Lower Haight. Not to say I don't absolutely adore the gritty charm of the neighborhood, but it's a nice respite. 

Since remodeling, the place is clean and welcoming, slightly Irish in it's theme, and pretty cozy (at least until the DJ starts cranking after 10 pm). The menu is fairly limited, and the food is simple, fresh and tasty with it's decidedly Southern flair.*
 
*For fans of mashed potatoes only - Nickies may have the best mashed potatoes quite possible the world has ever seen.

The service was fantastic, the beer cold and delish. I can't believe it took me so long to get down here and hang out.
author: Brandon B.

description: Came to Nickies last Thursday night and liked it enough to come back for Monday Night Trivia yesterday. I got there last Thursday night at about 11 and the place was not crowded, the 4 of us and we were able to get a table. The bar is pretty clean and did not smell like a bar when you walked in... which I loved. I hate walking into a place and smelling booze soaked into the walls. The DJ played good music, mostly 90's and some from early 2000's. Good crowd and good beer. Last night was trivia night starting at 8:15. Questions were harder than I thought but it was a really good time. I think this may be my new hang out.
author: Ashley M.

description: Me and my girlfriend love this place! Really chill place, it usually doesn't get too crazy but on a weekend I've seen it get really full. Food is good, service is awesome, friendly and fun bartenders. The baked mac and cheese is my favorite as well as the calamari. DJ usually plays really good music or they're usually playing a sports game on which is nice. Parking gets hectic sometimes but worth looking for. Oh and did I mention it's the only bar that I've witnessed people bring their dogs in and they never say anything. I love that!
author: Lynne E.

description:
Worst. Customer Service. Ever. 

Ordered dinner before the kitchen closed. Paid with my credit card. Waited. Waited. Waited. No food. Get up from the table and stand at the bar trying to get someone's attention to ask what the hold up is. Waited. Waited. End up walking back to the kitchen, where my food has been sitting for an eternity because its stone cold. Carry the plates myself from the kitchen to the bar. Try to get someone's attention. Finally explain to the bartender the issue. She explains to me that it isn't her job to bring the food out to me. What? I ask for a refund. She explains she can't do that. She takes the food away and apparently thinks this is the end of. Yet, I still paid $35 for food I never got. I ask for my money back again, which upsets her and she throws my receipt at me and calls me a b*$@h. ARE YOU KIDDING ME. Left without ever getting a refund. For food I never ate. 

Used to come here all the time, but the new help is awful. So, so, so awful. Will never return.
author: J J.

description: Got a bit trashed here recently at a friend's birthday party. Tons of fun, and I loved the bar- we had the back section reserved for us which made it even better. Drinks were good, DJ/music was good, all in all a nice place and a good night. I'd for sure come back again.
author: Melissa B.

description: Ventured here one Saturday night with a group of friends.  The vibe was good.  Great music playing and people grooving to the music.  It got a bit crowded, but, that only added to the fun of people watching.
author: Amber N.

description: denver broncos fans - come to nickies and make it the broncos bar!!!
author: Drew M.

description: Food was pretty decent.  Music kinda loud for a Wednesday night.  Waitress was really nice and patient with us.  Not a bad place to have around the corner.
author: Kacie O.

description:
great service
great place to watch sports
great food (had the steak sandwich)
decent brews
out of racer 5
down 1 star :(
author: Victor B.

description:
Nickie's is chill, plain and simple. Even on Friday and Saturday nights, the place is pretty busy, yet it is still got that laid back, relaxed feel, that isn't pretentious but certainly accommodating. The neighborhood is sometimes sketch, but when the cute bartender looks like Vinny Jones, you cant be bothered. 

4 stars, firm.
author: Sara A.

description:
I would give this place a 4 1/2 if i could. The new Chef, Hank (cool gal) has done a great job redoing the menu...I have had the sliders on two occasion's and both times they were awesome. I have also had the short ribs, they just fall apart and are tasty. Lastly, the fries Hank makes are some of the best fries I have had. Anyhow, if you are in the lower haight area and want some good food you need to stop by. Oh Ya, the Mac and Cheese looks tasty. That's my next meal there. 

Nice work Hank!
author: Ivan E.

description:
Nickies is an establishment in an identity crisis. Are they an Irish Bar with all the Guinness posters, Irish music and woodwork or are they a lounge with couches and areas to "lounge around or are they a club with dj's spinning and a large dance floor. They try to do too much with this place. I do like coming here but whenever I do it's not very crowded. I come on Sunday for brunch, or monday for cocktails, or Thursday for music and it seems as if they could be doing a lot better than what they are doing. Hopefully they can get a hard alcohol license, which may help them. I don't mind coming here though because I have the place to myself!!!
Also I was recently here on a sunday afternoon and heard the female chef yelling at the bartender in the back kitchen, not sure what it was about though.
author: D J.

description:
I like this place so much. The food is fair. The atmosphere is very friendly and warm. Everyone who works there is really nice and they seem to actually care about the customer even if its only for the moment they are at your table or serving you at the bar. Atmosphere and service are great reasons to go anywhere.

They have a free jazz night which is always good with me. I just like to go here. So chances are you just may see me if you're there.
author: Marz W.

description: I love this spot!!!  It was the PERFECT place to watch the Bears beat the Seahawks last weekend.  Not packed at all (yes, it was 10am), the food was really good for a bar, the waitress was very attentive.  I didn't have the bacon but it looked really good and the bread was delicious.  I wanted to order a BLT for lunch but I was still stuffed from my huevos rancheros that I had ordered for breakfast.
author: Joe K.

description: Great atmosphere. Kitchen is open till midnight or 1am depending on the night. Ever changing calender, I don't remember everything, but monday nights are going to be monday night football. Late night music is great by the DJ.
author: Robin L.

description: If you are traveling in SF for work and need a place to watch college basketball, I'm not sure there is a better place than Nickie's. Staff is genuinely warm. Food is uninspiring. Beer selection is just adequate.
author: Emerson B.

description: I like this bar.  It's a mellow vibe with great beers on tap and decent food.  There are lots of TV's with a broad mix of games on.  Service was friendly, I'd come back.  We came mid afternoon and it wasn't crowded but I imagine if the weather hadn't been so awesome more people would have been there.
author: Kirsten F.

description: My new favorite sports bar in the Mission/Lower Haight area.  I needed to find a new spot since my old spot, The Phoenix, is a sellout and no longer cares about service.  Anyways, the food at Nickies is great and you can't beat the all you can drink mimosas for $8 deal on Sundays.  $8 Mimosas, sports, & good food on Sundays to cure Saturday's hangover...now thats a win-win situation!
author: LIVE to E.

description:
Went there on a Saturday reading about the remodel.  I loved the old Nickie's back in the day and I was happy to read the positive reviews on yelp.  I wanted to see what it was all about.  I went in with my wife and another couple last Saturday night and the place was dead.  Including us, there were only 12 people in the place.  The music was all over the place.  Though I was happy they expanded their wine and beer selection, the signature drinks need work.

I'll check back in with you one day Nickie's to see if I just caught you on an off night.
author: Chris B.

description:
What a beautiful, stylish, NYC, spacious place....

And what a variety of Mojito's that will knock your socks off.

The drinks I had were smooth but strong, and affordable. And my friends liked theirs as well.

Although it feels the place might be too big for the type of crowd they're aiming for (mid-20s,  people who want to talk not so much dance),  they still had a DJ playing some jams, and the vibe was great.

Try the Mango Mojito, it is just magnificent.
author: Jorge C.

description:
Great decor!
Excellent burger trio!  (especially the blue cheese bacon burger)
Super cool bartender!

If only they served more than beer and wine......
author: Jamie B.

description:
Oh, how I want to like this place. The staff is pretty kind and you can tell they really put a lot into making this place look great.

But aside from a nice interior, there's not much else. I've now been twice and both times there's been absolutely no organization to the staff. They have menus, but you have to order at the bar. And that's when things get really messy. Both times I've been, my order has been lost/forgotten. And both times, once my order did come out, it was not right. 

In addition, the music is just awful. The last time I went they played nothing but tedious Bob Marley songs for about 2 hours straight. Yikes. And then the DJ arrived and the music got increasingly worse.

Overall: very nice layout, but they're forgetting the most important attribute to a great bar/restaurant (I'm not sure what this place is trying to be): service.
author: K F.

description:
I love this place because it is one of the places in the city where the men's bathroom has a line and the women's doesn't.  I know that is sick, but really, there is a deep dark side of me that goes back to the bathroom and is like "BWAHAHAHA"  you men.  WAIT.  WAIT IN LINE. 

Confused or not, Nickie's probably has the sweetest staff EVER!  I mean, really!  I have to agree with Jennifer when she said that this place accomodates a huge range of types of people.  I guess that sounds weird, but it's true.  We were sandwiched between a hot group of twenty something asian chicks dressed to the nines, and a dude with a mohawk and everybody seemed perfectly comfortable...  I really think this can be credited to the all star staff.  You know, like the people who work here seem really really good at finding common ground.  In my opinion that's one of the chief responsabilities of a bartender and they really GET THAT at Nickie's.

Going in here, we brought a whole group of peeps and took over the end of bar, like, BAD!  We drank champagne all night, but their beer and wine list was also great and we'll be back to taste more of that selection.

If you like bars that are really trying to look like they're not trying too hard, than you shouldn't come here.  Nickie's may not have a trendy identity, but isn't that a good thing? They're not trying to pigeonhole any one group of people to fit into their ideal of a customer. If this place's biggest fault is trying to do "too much" than fuck that.  

Oh yeah, the food... the food totally suprised me.  Check out the sliders.  Heaven.
author: Amy M.

description: Now this is an Irish bar! Great people, very nice atmosphere, top notch wood work, great food and reasonable prices.  You can definitely tell the owners take pride in their business.  So much nicer than that dump Danny Coyle's down the street..that place gives Irish bars a bad name!
author: Eric W.

description:
In all fairness, I went to Nickies years ago and had a blast. Drinks were flowing, the dancefloor was hopping, and everyone had a good time.

However, when Juicy and I went last Sunday morning for a quick bite it was a total bummer. We had a meeting to get to in about a 1/2 hour, so rather than wait in line at Kate's Kitchen, we decided to give Nickies' brunch a shot.

We walked in and were completely ignored by the bar wench. We looked for a menu with no luck.  We saw that people were indeed eating brunch, but decided we'd try somewhere else. On our way out we noticed a menu on the door. The breakfast sandwich caught our eye, so we thought we'd give it a shot.

We go back to the bar sit down and try to get the bartender's attention. No luck. I figure I'll go to the kitchen and put the order in since we're in a hurry.  On my way there the bartender stops me and asks what I'm doing. After I explain she tells me to let her do her job. Well then, do your job and take my order. I explain we're in a bit of a time crunch.

The rest of our experience is pretty much more of the same. When the expediter brings out our food, he walks past us where we're motioning for our food and hands it to the bartender. She then carries it back around the bar and serves it to us.

The food was acceptable, but overpriced. An English Muffin with a scrambled egg and a side of taytoes (an and unexplainable garnish of naked spinach) for $8.

Our mistake was going back after our initial reaction.  Overall the experience was tainted because the bartender was a little too preoccupied with her friends than providing any service to new customers.

They get one star for running after Juicy with her hat that she forgot.
author: SteveTwentyThree S.

description: So.....Needless to say I went back to Nickies. We had a group of 6 and were waited on by Jenni(?) We had her everytime at Nickies except for the day of the "bug" incident. She ended up finding out I had written the yelp review (which I feel horrible about) had her manager, Alexis(?) talk to us and comp'd our entire meal. We did NOT expect this and ended up tipping Jenni 100% of our meal. I do indeed retract my previous yelp review and will indeed come back.
author: Kat O.

description:
We were headed to Rosamunde for a Saturday afternoon sausage, when we passed a sign on the street.  Drinks?  Food?  Corrugated steel?  What is this place? The menu looked good, and the buns at rosamunde have been sucking ass lately, so in we went...

I saw the old sign, and only then did it hit me... Ah, yes, NICKIE'S.  I'd been here!  Cheb i Sabbah used to spin here.  Interesting.  I have to say, the place looks great, but I'm shocked they put that much money into a Lower Haight bar when the neighbourhood hasn't caught up.  I guess it's "aspirational?"  Yes, we will call it "aspirational."

But, we didn't go for the bar (beer and wine only now, they are tryng to get a full license), we went for the food.  My dining companion had the gumbo, I had the fried stuff from the sea bascket (calamari, shrimp, cod and hand-cut fries.)  His gumbo was awesome.  Perfectly spices, with the king of juicy rock shrimp that burst in your mouth.  Not at all fishy.  9Usually, the smaller the shrimp, the fishier, but my big shrimp were shrimpier than his!)  Nice spicy sausage.  He scraped the bowl as best he could with his spoon- were I not there, I think his face would have been in the bowl.  What really made my mixed-fried-stuff basket was the sauce.  A spicy chipotle take on tartar sauce.  And the batter was AWESOME!  All the fishly things were in the same flaky, well-flavoured crust. The calamari and fries could have been a little more crisp, but I'm just looking for counter-points now.

For a Saturday afternoon "don't want to to deal with the crowds across the street at Kate's or up the street at Magnolias" lunch-with-beer-option, this was perfect.  I assume this place wants to be a nightclub, though, and I can't rate it on that, hence the four-not-five stars.
author: Heather H.

description:
So I know gentrification is supposed to be a bad word and all (especially here in SF), but the Lower Haight might benefit a bit from it. At least, I like the sketch factor, but it's a tad too sketchy.

And that's where Nickies comes in. It's a pretty swank looking lounge smack in the middle of... well, smack heads. And dives like Noc Noc and Molotov's.

The place is alright. Friendly bar staff and it's usually not crowded. Plus it just looks nice. The leather seats are more form than function though (just not comfy) and the 800 cameras everywhere make me feel... Safe? Creepy? I suppose they're more for the owners and staff than for the clientele.

So yeah Nickies is part of the gentrification of the Lower Haight. And I don't know how I feel about it. I am open to change, but this establishment just doesn't seem to fit in the neighborhood.

Yet.
author: Trey F.

description:
Damn, she got a face lift. Sooo check her out...(still nostalgic for the old home styled slightly warped dance floor, but hey, it's all good, she mustagottasugadaddyindahoodie).

BUT, make sure you check out her myspace; sometimes she is on the rag, with the WORST kind of taste in music..WORST!!!!
author: miriam b.

description:
Nice vibe.  It was empty at 8 p.m. on a Friday, but by 10 p.m. the crowd was getting thick.  Decent amount of seating and seemed like a great crowd.  The DJ from a few Fridays ago, had some ecletic picks and mixed and weaved and did his thing.

I think they lost their full liquor license (Soju and Ginger Ale). . . but solid beer selection - I will be here often.
author: E L.

description:
Very cool sports bar. 

I recently was staying in the Lower Haight for like a month or so and would frequent Nickies during the World Series (Phillies vs Yankees) and some Eagles games.  A great place to watch any game with good food to choose from.  Bartenders are very cool too.

I recommend:

Chipotle Chicken sandwich
Mac n Cheese with Gouda

The also have brunch options with endless mimosas and bloody mary's for 8 bucks. You can't beat that shit! I haven't been while a DJ was spinning but they have a schedule of whats going on during the week.  Cool place to check out.
author: Terrel R.

description:
I was a big fan of Nickie's in the old days. Something comforting about a place with no sense of decor, but great music.  And having DJ Cheb i Sabah right around the corner every week.  Cheb is god.  Funk night was also a good scene.  Prince is god.
So now it's the new Nickie's, looking a little too much like the Pottery Barn catalog for me, but whatofit!  They moved on.  The crowd is still pretty friendly and neighborhoody, especially earlier during the week.  And the food is good.
And the music is still great.
author: Rob B.

description:
This place just (re)opened, so I'm waiting to see how things coalesce in the near future.  Once they tighten up the DJ line-up, menu, and the deal with ABC http://www.abc.ca.gov/ ...

...it will be the most happening spot on the Lower "East Side" of Haight.  For sure!
author: David S.

description:
The beats were sweet.

I went here for a friends birthday.  
The beers were $5.  
The decor was nice.
The DJ was on point with old school & new school hip hop.
They even had the Hawaii game on one of the three flat screens.
Check it out.
author: Po L.

description: It was a surprisingly gorgeous crowd when I stopped in on a Friday night.  This is the Lower Haight, right?  Good bar food served late, crowded on weekend nights, decent DJs, better-than-decent bartenders and servers.  What more could I ask for really?
author: Quinn S.

description: I've only been here in the afternoons for their burger special. All I have to say is that they make the best cheeseburgers for only $6! AMAZING!
author: David L.

description: Holy shit there are some hot people here on Friday nights. Maybe it's the 90s music putting me in a good mood.
author: Ryan V.

description:
I give this place a solid 4.5 maybe even a 5 for brunch. But until I come here to do some serious "drankin'" (Yelp elite calibur drinking honeys!) , I'm just going with the four. 

So yeah, John H. and I meandered here on a Sunday stroll down Haight. You know, one of those great walks that has no particular purpose but to enjoy the day. Since football season is over, walking has consumed my Sundays. Anyway like any given Sunday, we were in the mood for brunch (along with most likely half of SF) but weren't in the mood for an hour wait. Hmm...a sign advertising brunch drew us in and though it wasn't crowded at 12:30 on a Sunday, let me tell you, this may be a secret gem when it comes to eating brunch without (a) emptying half your wallet, (b) eating tasty food and drinking even tastier drinks and (c) mingling with a good staff and good crowd; I'm pleased to report/yelp that Nickies excels in all three categories. 

The atmosphere is equal parts Irish sports bar and Haight hipster without coming across obnoxious/ pretentious (not an easy feat). Nickie's has a large layout with lots of seating throughout the bar. Low tables, chairs and benches flank the front left sides of the bar while the bar and its stools lay along the right. Towards the back are some higher counters and stools (including this bitchin' counter that seats six right in front of a big screen TV). Low lighting compliments the dark wood and I have to say I'd give this bar three stars for the niceness of the bathroom alone. Go for yourself. 

Brunch was a complete success for both of us. The huevos rancheros I ordered were a perfect balance of all components. The black beans and ranchero sauce were appropriately spicy, the eggs the right amount of runny and there was a healthy serving of both the avocado and potatoes. The tortillas sadly, were only 'eh'. But the Bloody Mary I had with my meal more than made up for that. The taste of black pepper was strong but not overwhelming. John got an egg scramble chock full of veggies topped with mushrooms and cheese along with his always enjoyed Big Daddy. The scramble was a hefty size and he claimed that all the veggies had a nice crunch and flavor to them. Our server was all decked out for the Sunday before St. Patty's Day complete with green glitter that was cute but not annoying. She was totally on top of her game so hooray for her. Both meals and drinks together cost well under thirty dollars and quite honestly felt like a steal. 

But let me be honest, the whole brunch could have been ruined by one unintentional eyesore. You see, from my vantage point I was looking directly at large man ass crack. Yep, every time I looked over at my dining partner I was confronted by the tip of a blinding white moon. Now before you continue to wince/ laugh/ scream in terror, I do have to give the man some credit though. For starters there was no visible tufts of curly butt fur lingering about. Secondly, the guy was slightly aware of his fashion faux pas. He was considerate enough to hitch down his shirt in the back to the cover his plumber's smile but sadly, the shirt wouldn't stay. Ladies (and I use the term loosely with some of you- ha ha) haven't you ever been out only find the shirt/ pants you chose weren't quite cooperating with your body at the bar and you find yourself readjusting? That's what I thought.....Thirdly, I realized if I scooted over about a foot, I could use John's head as a shield from the view. Thanks hun.  

So yeah, what could have killed a lovely happy brunch or a stellar Bloody Mary or conversation with good company didn't. In fact, the whole brunch experience all together made me see the bright side of a Sunday without football. Even though it's still a healthy five months away, I've learned that it doesn't mean I can't enjoy the most chill day of the week. Cheers!
author: Veronica G.

description: I choose Nickies because of it's Yelp reviews and again,all the fabulous yelpers have come through and really hit the mark. I had drinks and snacks with some coworkers last weekend and we all really enjoyed ourselves.  The food was really tasty, especially the little burgers, yummy! Oooh and the garlic cheese fries were awesome. We had such a good time, will definitely come back. The service was fine, the prices were just right!
author: Gabrielle C.

description: I love this place for their $5 burgers & fries!  No kidding.  I went in here for lunch and was surprised at how good the burger was--thick paddy, flame broiled.  You can get with cheese and at such a deal, I added some bacon.  In comparison, I was over at No Beach Godfather the other day had a $8 burger and fries that was awful.  Back to Nickies' and they didn't disappoint.  Yeah, and watching the World Cup was nice but I rather keep my eye on the burger than the soccer ball.
author: Nancy H.

description:
this bar is right down the street from the bf's apartment in lower haight...and is a haven for us...or at least me.  i appreciate a place in his neighborhood where i can avoid the dirty hipsters that flock to bars like toronado & molotov.  it's nice to not have to fight a cigarette brigade at the door so big that it overtakes the sidewalk & spills out into the street.

nice staff, clean bathroom, good beers on tap & they show sports...yay.
author: Kyle F.

description: it's  my favorite neighborhood joint!  oh yah - and trivia night is pretty fun, too! :)
author: Tina J.

description: Stopped in with a friend for a late night burger and beer.  First I couldn't even find an employee.  Finally someone came out so we sat at the bar.  The drink was OK, nothing special, and was ordered on the rocks yet came out in a martini glass.  After 20+ minutes (and no one else was ordering food) our burger and fires arrived: cold.  We sent it back, and after waiting for a while for the replacement my friend said "Forget it, we're leaving.  We don't want the burger any more."  To which the bartender called my friend a "c**k-sucker" and told him not to come back!  No worries there!  There is nothing so special at Nickies that it can't be found in plenty of places where the service is good and the employees don't call the customers names!
author: Trish D.

description:
i was ambling down haight, headed from hayes valley  to mad dog trivia night, and happened to look right just as i passed nickie's.

*whoa* *double take* that looks like a sleek (dare i say *sexy*) bar in the,  huh, LOWER HAIGHT???  years before, i discounted club deluxe from the outside as too chichi to possibly fit into upper haight and boy was i wrong there, so i made a mental bookmark to check nickie's out when i got a chance.

after being asswhooped at trivia, my crew still had some steam to blow off and so we ended up at nickie's.  $5 cover (that's the -1 star...wtf, cover???  on a *tuesday*???  in the lower haight???).  anyway, very sexy interior.  it was almost empty when we walked in (about 12:30a), and music was too loud (thievery corp, gotan project kinda stuff).

then, it got really weird.  we were sitting away from the bar so we could hear ourselves and suddenly we look up, and dance floor is packed.  well, not hot and sweaty everybody grinding up on each other packed, but just bustling lots of folks dancing packed.  they were playing lots of bhangra beats but it was a bunch of white people dressed up in indian clothes dancing.  once again:  wtf???  well, we just hopped right in and twisted and gyrated for a bit.

my favorite part was the bathroom.  geez, from now on, if i need to take a piss in the lower haight, i'll pay the $5 cover just for the bathrooms.  i know, i'm classy like that :).  all in all, 4 stars for one of the best nights out i've had in a while!!
author: Roshni R.

description: Fav sports bar in the city. Clean, bunch of tvs, not too crowded. Good for NFL or college football. Amazing veggie burgers (never thought I'd say that) and French fries.
author: Matt M.

description: So, Nickie's is all brand new now. No longer is it a dimly lit sonic assault on your senses, but rather a wood-paneled and cajun-spiced type of a joint. Now that is fancier on the inside, it doesn't feel like a lower haight kind of place anymore, but considering that this side of filmore is in desperate need of renovation in general, I mark it up as a positive upgrade. The beer prices are on the higher side, though, and for just standard pub brews. It stings a bit, especially since you can go just down the street to Toronado and get premium beers for about a buck less. But, I think the ambiance is totally different, so you are paying for the mellowness. It feels like the most "grown-up" bar in the area, which can be nice every once in a while. One thing to try once you are here is the chips, which are actual thick slices of potato, fried. Not bad.
author: Tom H.

description: This is old-skool Haight, always good memories. Sometimes a youngish crowd but I still will find myself over there on Tuesday nights for some world beats. Dinga ding good times!
author: Nish N.

description: Staff friendly! Very accomodating to sports fan who want to also hear the game...Bottomless Mimosa's worth it:) Great atmosphere!!!
author: Tweet D.

description: Blah Blah... this place was weak sauce. no dj or music. no talent or patrons on wed night. bartender non existent. taps mediocre. prob not return unless invited to special event here.
author: Alex S.

description: That's right, Nickie's BBQ is a kick-ass, divey club (that calls itself a funk-house dancehall), not a place to get ribs. It's got different dj's playing different types of music every night:  Monday night is Dark Star Dan playing Grateful Dead Jams (and you can even see people whirling in place, an almost-lost art form that will be familiar to dead heads), Tuesday night is World Beat Night, Fridays is funk and hip-hop, Saturdays is hip-hop and mid-tempo.  If you show up before 10 you can usually get in without paying the $5 cover.  Be prepared for the wafting smell of pot smoke. And when you're all danced out, go next door for a great slice of pizza, NYC style.
author: Debbie A.

description: Love this place!  I've been here twice now and each time has been a great experience.  The bartender is so nice.  When we had questions about the drinks he actually sat down at our table and answered them for us.  A very chill and very friendly guy.  The cucumber martini is incredible.  It might very well be my new favorite drink!  The food is great two.  Last night I had the Burger Triples, which are three mini gourmet burgers with great homemade fries on the side.  The prices aren't bad either - everything was very resonable.  There is always music in the background.  It was never too loud that I couldn't clearly hear my friends around the table.  The DJs the two nights I have been were both really good.  Gives the whole place a nice lounge environment.  I would highly recommend this place, and I can't wait to go back.
author: Scottie M.

description: Surprise Surprise, Nickies is not just another bar. Over the past six months my friends and I have used Nickies as a place to go to when we wanted a clean, nice casual atmosphere to have a beer. Little did we that Nickies has a kitchen that is serious. Don't call it bar food, there are real chefs, not cooks preparing your food. Gourmet style mac&cheese, burgers fries, heartily salads etc. Good place to watch a game and to see live Irish music. Also, as a Lower Haight insider, Nickies will have a full liquor license as of the 13th of October. Not just beer and wine any more.
author: Alejandro M.

description:
Nickie's is fantastic! It is my favorite bar in the Haight- always a good time! The bartenders are friendly, knowledgeable, attentive and even fun. The bar is cozy without being a small space, warm lighting, nice & comfortable decor- definitely not a dive bar, however no bit of pretentiousness. 
I have been there for football games and there is always a fun enthusiastic crowd assembled, without the annoyingness of the usual sports bar types. 
Friends and I hosted a surprise birthday party there recently which turned out to be a really great celebration thanks to the gracious help of the bar manager and super work of the bartenders who quickly and efficiently served a very thirsty large group! The food is great too! We ordered food for our event which received rave reviews from our guests- it was all served hot, quick and so tasty! 
All said, it's always proved to be a perfect place to meet friends and have a fun time!

Ps: to address a previous post- they definitely serve "hard liquor"- it is a FULL bar (with heavy handed pours even! Woo hoo!)
author: M M.

description: WONDERFUL food! Great atmosphere, great place to go and chill or watch games or even bust a move later in the evening. Staff and owners are fun, friendly and good looking!
author: C E.

description:
the place is totally remodeled. you step in, and it does not look anything like the old joynt -i like it. its hard to imagine this is in the 400 block of Haight St. they need to start promoting with the right people, and it should take off...sumfin' like what Madrone is doing, as a friend of mine suggested. word is that Cheb i Sabbah will be bringing his residency back here on Tues after a two year hiatus (well, he was down @Underground SF for over a year on Weds).

btw, they have Chimay on tap? yay! plus they serve soju infused mixed drinks, which are pretty darn good, and priced right. they seem to have the look down, now its time to hit it hard on the promotion side, and get the crowds rolling in!
author: Sha A.

description: When are you re-opening Nickie's? I still can't forget my hot date there. Literally Hot. I couldn't stop sweating from dancing to all the awesome world beats. I miss you. Please come back.
author: wendy p.

description: I've visited Nickies twice now to catch the football game, and let me just say that I absolutely love it!!  There's a full bar, flat screens playing multiple games, the food is AMAZING for a sports bar (try the Smokin Chipote Chicken Breast Sandwich, it's mouth watering), $3 beer when the 9ers are playing, and the place is super clean!!!  Only thing that's kind of a bummer is that although the servers are friendly and helpful, the service isn't the fastest, even when they're not that busy.  That aside, Nickies is great. Go check it out!!!
author: Tiffani M.

description: Good atmosphere & great music. The place is really clean which always gets extra points in my book. The husband liked the food and I loved the cocktails, solid establishment that we will most likely visit again real soon!
author: Angela T.

description: Great food and great fun!  It is down the street from our house and whether it is packed or only half full it is a great place to hang.  The food is fabu thanks to Chef Eric and all the bartenders are servin' you with a smile.  Go in and enjoy the Traditional Irish Session on Sundays...you will thank me later.
author: Ashley E.

description: Super cool neighborhood bar with a fantastic menu. Seriously if you see a lady with a kid at the bar - it is me. Come introduce yourself, I'll be too drunk to judge -  don't worry they serve food, it's cool.
author: kristen l.

description:
What a great sports bar. We watched the US-Canada olympic hockey game here and the atmosphere was awesome. They turned off the music and had the live play-by-play on the speakers throughout the bar. The crowd was not overly obnoxious, as sometimes is the case with sports bars, rather they were into the game, but kept everything civil.

In addition, the brunch menu was awesome- great potato hash with eggs and cheese! And the waitress was very attentive and friendly.

Would definitely come back.
author: Melanie W.

description: We were up in SF from Los Angeles to visit some friends who live near by and wow what a great place we happened to find.I was told that they just reopened after  remodeling.I dont know what the place looked like before but it is sweet now.We  stopped in for a couple of beers and decide where we should go for dinner.The bartender,tadgh i think his name was recommended we eat there.Iam not a fan of bar food but what the hell we took a chance.Goodness he was right on the food was great.I recommned this place for the food alone.The service was great and attentive.The bartender Tadgh , i think he said he was irish was great, allways checking if we needed anything else  even when he was a little busy.I will be back on my next trip to SF.
author: Andy L.

description: All my close friends were in town for the PARADOX LIVE PA next door at Underground SF. We decided to stop by Nickies for some pre-party drinks and it came recommended by DJ Angst. We all had beers, some shots of tequila and Grey Goose/Cranberry. Strong pour on the drinks from very nice bartenders. Def check out the happy hour action. They got DJ's too. Some girl DJ was cutting up old school hiphop while we were there. Not bad.
author: Alex M.

description: This is a sweet surprise in Lower Haight. Dropped by on a whim and didn't expect a classy bar. It was fairly empty, but this is the kind of place you go to when you already have good company and you're just looking for quick easy drinks, lots of space to sit, and awesome music. They don't serve hard liquor, so couldn't get my usual gin and tonic. We got a couple bottles of wine instead. Boy did we underestimate the strength of wine. But it was good. Real good.
author: Victoria N.

description: I don't know much about the place, other than being there twice in two days with a friend, who actually makes a point of going there whenever she is in the city, which with a globetrotter like her based in Colorado - does not happen too often. And she goes there only because of the barman named Alan. He is a kind of ideal barman you can think of. Listens without passing judgment. Offers good advice. Always willing to help. In no time becomes your best friend. And when that happens, you come just for him. Well, Alan is not my friend just yet (he has a say in that after all too), but I can surely understand how his personality makes all the difference in your bar experience. I am sure to drop by when I am in the hood. I am certain it will happen when my friend gets back to town.... What can I say - people make a difference. Always knew that. This bar is lucky to have Alan.
author: Rob R.

description: Nickie's is indeed a dive dance club which is a beautiful thing all its own and a Lower Haight institution. You also got The Top down the street if the beat is not to your liking at Nickie's.
author: patrick g.

description: This place is great! Cool ambiance, nice bartender, great DJ on a Friday night.  I highly recommend a trip here to check it out.  Get your dance on if you want!
author: Corey V.

description: I came on Sunday to watch some football and I had a decent time.  There were a lot of of Steelers fans so if that's your team then this is the bar for you.  However, the atmosphere wasn't enough for me to want to come back again.  The food was okay but nothing special enough that I would want to come back another time.  Plus, the place can get a bit warm since they only have ceiling fans.  So I satisfied my curiosity by coming here once but next time I'll try another sports bar.
author: Laura C.

description: This place is chic, has a cool interior, but it a bit of a sore thumb in the lower haight.  It doesn't have the funky lower haight vibe as the rest of the bars and restaurants in the area.  The crowd is pretty unremarkable, sort of nondescript.  Bland, even.  Would I return? Yes, although only if it was someone else's idea.
author: Jen H.

description:
beer and wine only.

experienced the staff to be a bit moody and confrontational (ie: drunk).

It was alright - served as a good meeting place for the crew that got together there.. nothing amazing though, slightly depressing inside.
author: Mr J.

description: Ryan is the best bartender ever! This place rocks, they did a great job inside and out it looks like they spent a lot of money! menu looked fab, will have to try some food there next time we go!
author: Mickey Z.

description:
the 5 stars are for the bacon and cabbage on a wednesday nite,its the closest to a proper irish dinner that i have had in the last 4 years,and it leaves me stuffed every time i eat it.
next time i am in i may go into the kitchen a show the chef how we make mashed potatoes in ireland.just boil  add salt pepper milk little bit of butter and mash,simple.
author: Shaunie M.

description: Nickies is a go-to spot in the Lower Haight for a few drinks and well-made, high quality bar food.    I live in the Lower Haight and often use it as a meet-up spot with friends or to grab lunch mid-week.  The staff are attentive and friendly - especially if sitting at the bar.  In the evening, the crowd definitely gets more lively and they have a varied and regular rotation of DJs and live music all week.   There certainly is a large neighborhood crowd here, but also a good mix from outside the LH - everyone feels welcomed.  The complete remodel a few years back and the addition of liquor to its repertoire have really transformed Nickies for the better.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Anyone else notice it looks EXACTLY like Range?
author: Evan B.

description: Great place.  Spicy jumbalya.
author: Bernard W.

description: Wandered into this place after finding Memphis Minnie's disappointingly busy (hey I thought people weren't eating out as much).  Fortunately I knew that it had to be decent after a quick search of Yelp on the iPhone.  Sat down at the bar and ordered a pint of Big Daddy while perusing the menu.  Better than standard bar fare, plus they actually did have formal table seating, but this is clearly has a bar first atmosphere.  At the bartender's recommendation I tried the boneless fried chicken.  The crust had a nice spice to it, if a little bit heavy on the clove, and the handcut fries were excellent.  The portion and the quality were a great value at $11.  The guy next to me raved about the Jumbalaya and the fish'n'chips also sounded quite good.  I'll be back for sure.  Great option to add to the repertoire in the lower Haight.  Oh and one more thing, the beer selection was very good too.
author: Al K.

description: One of the nicer bars the lower height has to offer.  Very comfortable interior, big place with two separate bars.  Food was decent, menu seemed heavy on the deep fried options.  I've only been once, and plan on going back.  Do note that they currently only serve beer/wine, no liquor.
author: Andrew R.

description: I like Nickie's... it is close to home, they have Peroni and it is pretty inside. But, the music is WAY too loud. If there are only 5 people in there, turn it down. Jeez.
author: Amelia L.

description: This may be another new hangout spot-went by on a Wed night-live jazz and delicious food-it was so warm it was just like home! The jazz was awesome i can't believe there was no cover. The mashed potatoes are so delicious. Even came today for brunch and Sunday Funday football. Brunch food was great-had the omelette, and my friends had the pancakes & english muffin-very very good. It took awhile to get the food today, but there was only one bartender/server. It was great to hang out today-there was plenty of room, great atmopshere and every game on! I'm coming definitely again on a Wed night.
author: Dessa R.

description: this place was legit! all walks of life... and since i went there on the day of the Giant's parade it was probably the most packed its ever been on a wednesday afternoon! plus Journey's greatest hits was on Repeat so it made it all the better! I am not sure if this is the case all the time or if it was just in celebration of the Giant's parade but i devoured one of their $5 burgers... it was a giant burger with fries all for $5! no, thats not a typo! I will be back there soon!
author: Norma O.

description: Very swanky interior.  Loved walking in and being surprised it wasn't a grungy bar!  I had jambalaya, not a good order because i forgot I don't really like sausage but the chicken fingers appetizer was good.  I was also jealous of my boyfriends order, 3 mini cheeseburgers and fries.  Yum.  Very clean and good service.  Check it out.
author: Andrea R.

description: P is batting 3 for 3.  Hot!  How did I not know about this place?  Apparently, Nickies was renovated recently and has probably become the sleekest bar in the Lower Haight.  Unfortunately, they don't serve the hard stuff, but their selection of wines and draft beers more than makes up for it.  They also have soju, the so-called Asian Vodka (er, not really).  The bar bites are tasty.   We had the burger triples (perfect little burgers they were), the chicken tenders (a bit on the dry side), and the spinach and mushrooms (yum!)  There's a DJ and dance area in the back but we were too early for that.  The bar still played some good background beats for P and me to groove to with our meal.  I am coming back!
author: Pelle Y.

description: The only reason they deserve 2 stars is for the decor.  Nice, clean, sleek, minimalist, wood and mirror interior.  Unfortunately, I have made the mistake of checking out this place twice, hoping it might be better the second time.  Well...it wasn't.  Maybe I have gone on the WORST nights ONLY but both times I was not impressed with the music or the mixing of the music at all. The ONLY way it would have been appropriate is as background music while shopping at Old Navy and while scoring 8 shirts, 2 pairs of pants and some socks for under 100 bucks.
author: Suzanne L.

description:
groovy pub / bar combo
good pub food, i love the greasy little sliders.  for all of the 4 mins it takes to troff them...
liqour and beer license so get involved
has a weird mix of local haightsters and a bit naff 'townie' crews.
author: david s.

description: I watched the Giants clinch the NLCS here and have paired this bar with fun and absolute happiness so my review maybe a little biased but I love this place. They have bottomless Mimosas until 2 pm and a pretty good brunch menu. Food isn't amazing but it's decent inexpensive brunch food. For an entree and mimosa I believe everyone's tab came out to be $20.  Not bad at all. Lots of televisions and lots of seating and their ervice is pretty good. The bar was wall to wall packed for the Giants' games and they handled the crowd well. I never felt as if I had to wait too long for a drink. They have the NFL ticket on Sundays so the bar attracts a variety of fans from everywhere. It's a great sunday funday place.
author: Sierra d.

description: This place was definitely a great place to chill. The atmosphere is very non-threatening and very neighborly. I thought it was cool that they had a girl dj who played some decent music. Seems like a fun hangout for the locals. Minus the fact that there were two very drunk older men who were totally outta control stomping and yelling around the whole place, my friends an i had a great time. The menu was surprisingly affordable!! My husband and I ordered the hanger steak--very yum. There was a decent beer selection both on tap and bottled. I liked that the music wasn't so loud that you couldn't hear and the lighting wasn't so dark that you coudn't see. It was a very nice experience. We're definitely going back again!
author: Jessy M.

description: I had never been to Nickie's before the remodel, maybe that's better because I was fully impressed.  The space is really great, a ton of wood makes it feel really warm.  We had the mac and cheese and the mini-burgers.  I loved the burgers but the mac and cheese needs work.  As a lounge/bar, the atmosphere is great...DJ is a nice plus.
author: cristina t.

description: Great place to grab some mac n cheese, and a beer to wash it down, around dinner time. I'm a man of simple tastes.
author: Bob M.

description: 3.5. wasn't impressed, wasn't unimpressed. didn't eat. didn't feel compelled to spend too much time here. that being said i would return to dine there and update my review after. the .5 was because i used the restroom and it was nice and clean. yay!! who doesn't love a clean bathroom?
author: kiki b.

description: When I first moved to the City I would come here a lot.  It was a dump. Fridays were Funk and Soul and Sundays were Reggae. Always a really good vibe. The place has been totally remodeled and they have a few good items on their menu. The music varies, so for sure you should check out what is going on. I am glad that at least it stayed a night life venue.
author: heather o.

description: My friends and I went here last Thursday night.  The bar was mostly empty, but it took almost 20 minutes for all 6 of us to get drinks.  The second round took even longer.  One of the guys in my group got so fed up, that he asked one of the nice server ladies to grab our drinks for us.  The bartender also served one of my friends a Hemp Ale that appeared to be more of a mix of Newcastle and something rather than Hemp Ale.  At that point, we left, and went across the street to Toronado, where the bartenders are competent, and the beer costs a dollar less.
author: Courtney G.

description: Decent sandwich, friendly service, but couldn't enjoy it much with the music blasting way too loud considering there were about 5 of us in the place.
author: Jason B.

description:
Great jazz on Wednesdays, no cover - OOP-BOP-SHA-BAM.  Good acoustics - the band is upfront by the door and we were seated at a table along the wall.  
The fish 'n chips was a Wednesday's Special; 3 lightly battered big shrimps, 3 pieces of fish on a generous mound of crispy fries with aioli $10.  Excellent!  with a happy hour $3.50 Trumer Pilsner.  
Yummy moist boneless 3-pc. Fried Chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy $11 with a happy hour pour of Prohibition Big Daddy $3.50 - another winner.
Friendly bartender + delicious food + good music = a great neighborhood drop-in from 6 to 9 pm
author: Geri S.

description: Good food, good tunes, and good beer. Just what the lower haight needs...
author: Jonjo O.

description: went here to watch a sunday night football game with a friend. sat a the bar and had the jambalaya. the food was good. the place is nice looking, clean and new looking. the bar tenders were friendly. we had a great time. i need to try the brunch.
author: Geoff B.

description: I still miss Sunday nights at the Bodhran, so this is the next best thing for live Irish tunes.
author: Jenny W.

description: OK, here's something that you have to know about this area--almost no liquor licenses. However, I am getting more and more impressed with how creative non-liquor license establishments are getting with a certain magic potent potable--SOJU! Oh yeah! And this place by and far has been the most impressive with their soju drinks. Their soju-jito type drinks are pretty slick. And the soju with ginger ale is fabulous--favorite beverage I've had in a while actually. It was pretty dead when we were there though---and that is such a shame because this place has a lot of potential. I liked the ambiance and the DJ and what little of the crowd was there. There was this hilarious middle-aged woman who kept trying to get random strangers to dance with each other. She was also full of the oddest compliments too. Once she got me to dance (and trust me, it is a sight to see if I could dare to flatter myself), she told me that I was a beautiful dancer and should be on "American Idol." Got it gentleman! Take this "American Idol" to Nickies! (And I'll have another soju with ginger ale.)
author: Zulu Q.

description: Wow, I guess I wasn't expecting the eclectic mix of vibes that Nickies pulls together, but somehow Nickies just pulls it off.  I dropped in on a Sunday night around 7 pm to check out the traditional Irish music which was amazing!  Nickies has traditional Irish music playing every Sunday night starting around 6 pm, so check it out!  Full disclosure ~ my roommate is one of the fiddlers and is amazing in her own right, but I digress....  I ordered the Spicy Jambalaya because, well, it just sounded right at the time.  I wouldn't normally associate Jambalaya with Irish music, but it worked.  The Jumbalya was filled with both shrimp and sausage and had quite a kick (thus the name spicy; yes, I'm quick on the uptake.).  The bartender doubled as the waiter and did an excellent job answering my questions while making sure I had everything I needed ~ he was great!  The atmosphere itself was part neighborhood, cozy pub, part trendy lounge; again, the mixture of themes didn't seem discordant.
author: Matt P.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood spots.  It has enough TV's to satisfy the various sports fans you might go eat with, has an eclectic (yes, sometimes an 80's punk rock song is followed up with a 90's hip hop song...) music selection.  They regularly have a variably of specials depending on the day/month/season but I especially love their mac n cheese, as well as their fried chicken.  Sometimes they're short staffed and the music can be really loud but then again it is a bar and it's a sports bar as well.  Pretty cleanly for the most part and now they have specials on some of their appetizers on different evenings.
author: Ive M.

description: this place is awesome. not just because the bouncer let me pose as the bouncer and check ID's, not only cuz they have a dj live on friday night, not only cuz they have great beer on tap. but because it's a solid joint in the lower haight, i am all in baby.
author: David D.

description: I loved this place but am still a bit confused since it is supposed an Irish bar but trendy as hell looking just down the street from the projects. This whole neighborhood has been changing for years and Nickies is a welcome addition to that. Heard that it had been recently renovated and it looks devine. Very large, lots of shiny pretty wood accents and a great bartender. Unfortunately I don't remember her name, especially since we had been drinking before we got there. But I do remember she was sassy and efficient, just like I like them. What I do remember is that they serve champagne by the glass there and one of the glasses had the word "sex" in it. Had to try it. Wasn't bad. They serve yummy food per the nice boys sitting next to us. I tend to talk to strangers a lot. Keeps me from getting bored. I would like to say that I'll be back often but I can't walk home after drinking here. But I'll definitely be back when in the neighborhood.
author: Heather L.

description: I met a group of friends here on Saturday for a Birthday Brunch/ Lunch and it is now my new favorite for one reason- Bottomless Mimosas: $8!  Call me a lush- but you just can't beat that, especially in SF, especially in this economy.  To  top it off we had a super nice waitress, they played good upbeat music and the food was tasty ( I had the garden burger).  Haven't been here at night- but I heard they have Magner's specials- which also ranks them tops in my book.
author: PDX t.

description: The new owners have done a terrific job upgrading the bar to the level it is today. The bar maintains a lot of its original charm and character. Restrooms are clean, as is the bar. Great selection of drinks and daily food offerings.
author: Paul R.

description: Definitely one of my new fav neighborhood hang-outs!  Was I prepared for the pleasant surprise when randomly dropping in on a Wednesday night to finally check out the place after owner change and renovations?  Certainly not.   Live Jazz band, cozy atmosphere, great food at decent prices paired with friendly and accommodating staff in my neighborhood, walking distance from my house... I was so SOLD, right there and then!  I like the Wed Jazz nites the best although that very first week, I actually ended up going there three nites in a row.  Guess I wanted to make sure that I wasn't dreamin' that first nite.  The only, and really the one and only downside is that there are only a couple of tables that comfortably seat tall people... Most of the tables are too low.  So I'm hoping that either, I'll shrink in the course of time OR Nickies might exchange some of the low tables in favor of their taller patrons.  Oh, yeah, and maybe they could add an outdoor patio for their smoking patrons but that's probably going to remain wishful thinking.  Either way, I'll be back and recommend it for any night of the week that calls for a place to chill and wind-down.
author: Sabine W.

description: first off, since when is haight and fillmore hayes valley? um, NO. lower haight, bitches. stopped in here after a friend's art opening on a saturday night. haven't been in years, since before the remodel. snazzy! decent wine list for a club! it still has a good dive bar feel despite all the glam. i'd go back, sure. but no hard booze because of that retarded rule they have up here in the hood.
author: Mary V.

description: nickie's made me feel that i had somehow time-travelled back to a basement social house party where all that was missing was the free beer and freshmen. on another night, the divey-ness might have made this place for me. but in my experience, its emptiness just made it seem uncool. pros: cute bartender (generous too), tasty soju, good music to pole-dance to. cons: nasty bathroom, unqualified cover, location not ideal.
author: julia r.

description: Friday night hit! Food was yummy, mac n cheese mmm. Fun staff made me feel at home, funny and pro bartenders! Super busy and good looking party people. I have found my new hangout!
author: Ramona G.
