description: i was very excited when nickies reopened. as i had never been there before the remodel i had no expectations. i really love what they've done with the interior. romantically lit, but you can still see the menu and your friends in front of you. they have a nice selection of quality snacks at lower haight prices. mac and cheese and other fried things abound on the menu. we ordered the cajun chicken strips(needed salt and more spice) and the yummy trio of burgers.  lovely to look at and especially to eat. our server gal was very nice and attentive. nickies is a beer and wine only establishment, so if ye be needin hard liquor, be lookin elsewhere.
author: Jennifer M.

description: So it's a Tuesday, my friend's and I are hanging out in Lower Haight, we're hungry and in need of a beer. Well let's try someplace new... that place looks cool. Nice exterior, the menu sounded pretty good too. Okay, lets try it. The inside was beautiful, there were less than 10 people in the whole place when we walked in around 6:45pm. Sweet, 15 minutes left of happy hour. We found a table in the corner, checked out the menu again, and after waiting for a few minutes realized that the solo bartender was in the weeds. Yes, you heard me right, 10 people in the bar (14 with the addition of my friends and I, but we weren't even acknowledged yet so we don't count.) and she's already totally overwhelmed. So we decide that waiting at the table is just rude when she's so busy, and we go to the bar to order drinks and "nachos". She was a sweet girl, we got our drinks and sat back down. ...time passes.... 45 minutes later we finally get our Irish nachos. They're okay, mostly cold though. We decide to give it another chance because a second girl has showed up to help. Cool, we'll order dinner and more drinks. It came out in about 30 minutes, still FAR too long when you're starving. During that wait, the DJ started. Definitely not what I was expecting. Kind of a house, hip-hop, techno mush. I can't describe it, except it was WAY too loud for any type of music. At this point we've been there for over an hour and a half. Barely got 3 beers each, and when the food arrived, it wasn't even that good, especially after waiting that long for it. Around the time the DJ started (8pm) the place started to fill up, mostly with marina type people. They seemed to be enjoying themselves. So if you're into that vibe, you may love it. I, on the other hand, would rather carve out my liver with a red hot spork.
author: Joy T.

description: upscale bar food, good nightime dj and live music, reasonably priced drinks, beautiful interior. bring your friends and do some blow off the tables in the front.  that seems to be what the cool kids are doing.
author: regina k.

description: Great place, When I walked in I was very surprised because of the arm pit and weed smell that was outside. It was a pleasure to walk in. I went there to watch a game and grab a bite to eat, its the only place that is within walking distance with good food, beer, and company (I will probably be there for MNF tonight). I have had the wings, the triple burger, and one of the salads, ALL good. ALSO, last time I was there I overheard the bartenders say that they just got their liquor license and were trying to scramble for liquor! Hopefully they will have good Kentucky Bourbon Whiskey!!!
author: Alterego M.

description: This place is such a diamond in the rough of the lower Haight. Great Beer with a really good Food menu and value for money you can hardly beat in all of SF. The staff are friendly, fun and helpful. Best of all check out the Irish session every Sunday night. I'd sware its the same guys who used to do that great Irish session in An Bodhran before that place closed down. Really chilled and relaxed atmosphere to spend your Sunday evening before getting back into the rat race.
author: willie l.

description: update........this place now serves hard liquor, and the best of!  their margarita rocks!  staff are really cool, and can mix up any libation you wish.   theres always a great atmosphere and the music is pretty damn good too!   great irish whiskey selection.  karaoke tuesdays is a gas!
author: Clare K.
